Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at The Gladstone Hotel .We ended up staying here unexpectedly when we were on a quick visit to Toronto and booked our room sight unseen online. Our first impression of the hotel was that the staff works incredibly hard to make guests feel welcome and that a lot of time has been taken to create individually beautiful rooms. There are details everywhere that contribute to the high quality of the building while still maintaining it's artistic integrity. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever had and a late night trip to the bar for a meal was one of our best decisions. Great food and staff!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Night Club not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan41169
Reviews.Content: What a disaster of a hotel. The night I arrived (a Friday) the young hip clerk informed me that there would be a party in the ballroom until 4am. It was only when I tried to sleep on the third floor that I realized why he told me - my bed was literally shaking with the beat of the music. I don't know what was worse....that or the drunken screaming outside the windows from the party people occupying the hotels two bars. Oh, maybe it was the drunk people who had snuck up to the third floor to look and loudly critique the artwork right outside my door. The fact that I was in Toronto for work and had to get up for a presentation the next day made me think that I was being unfair in my increasing hatred of this place. However, the next night, and the night after, while the parties in the ballroom were over before 4am the drunken street noise from the hotel bars and the loud art critiques outside my door continued. As well, the room I stayed in was certainly enjoyably arty, but getting rather worn and dated and the bathroom contained so tiny a sink my toothpaste tube was too big to rest on the edge. The elevator is super cool, a really old one with the decorative iron cage, but not at all helpful in the morning when trying to haul suitcases downstairs to grab a cab because the front desk people were unable to help me because they were literally (no lie) cleaning up vomit on the front steps from the party-goers the night before.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: geemacman
Reviews.Content: Besides being one of the most interesting boutique hotels in Toronto, the staff are excellent. Queen Street West is a great place to be based -- but if you're looking for quiet at night you should try to get a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best wake venue ever!”
Reviews.Author: MMA_Dad
Reviews.Content: This may sound odd, but the Gladstone hosted the wake of a close friend of mine recently. It was his wish that the event be a celebration and the Gladstone delivered in spades. It might sound a tad morbid but it was the best party I had been to in years. The food (chicken satay, fresh cut fries, cupcakes, and other assorted finger foods) was fantastic. The staff was helpful and attentive although overworked (it was as packed a a New Years Eve party). I would like to thank everyone at the Gladstone for doing such a great job. May good fortune bless his wife and son.

Reviews.Title: “Our Adam Cohen weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gen_Cumpson
Reviews.Content: We walked into The Gladstone Hotel and were blown away ! The staff took such good care of us! We felt welcome and accepted. The Billio Room was heavenly, The Racine Room was divine, the food fabulous and the Burlesque Show was a sight to be seen. We are already planning our next trip !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hip, but a little unpolished”
Reviews.Author: slavka1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great area and looks great from the outside. The concept is fun and interesting and you certainly feel like you're in the middle of everything. We stayed in the Lehtinen Lodge which is a beautifully designed room but super small. Which is no big deal if you're only going to be in the room to crash, but that wasn't the purpose of my visit. Hanging out in the room the only place to relax was on the bed, and with luggage and toiletries, the room got messy really fast. The cleanliness of the room was what was really surprising. Coming back from our afternoon out, our room had been cleaned but I'm pretty sure it was done by a teenager. The bed was made but it was messy and they left the half full glasses of wine and an ice bucket from the night before in which all the ice had clearly melted. Room service is also pretty much nonexistent, even thought there's a kitchen downstairs. You can order ice from the front desk and a fun option is preordering coffee for the morning. Unfortunately the coffee is terrible. So if you're a snob about coffee, skip it. The amenities in the room are great. They provide you with snacks, and the best fair trade chocolate in the world as well as bottled water and a bottle of wine, and the prices aren't as exorbitant as minibars usually are in hotels. They also provide you with ear plugs. With good reason. If you're a light sleeper, use them. Especially on the weekend. The staff are young and hip and much more professional than I expected from a hipster hotel (that's a good thing). We ate one night in the fine dining restaurant and the food was delicious and it's locally sourced and organic which it a huge plus. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. I loved being in a busy, fun, interesting neighbourhood and the art all over the hotel was also fabulous as was the historic value. If you're young and have money to burn and don't care about things like great service, then this is the place for you. But for my money, I would have liked more polished service. Which is disappointing because I think it's a great space. I'm not positive I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gladstone in summer 2011. For the price and the way it markets itself as an artsy hotel, I was expecting a lot and ended up being pretty disappointed. The quality of your stay greatly depends on the room you get. First, avoid rooms facing Queen Street or Gladstone Avenue, the noise is simply unbearable. At least the hotel has the decency to offer free ear plugs, but there's a good reason for it. On my first night I was in a room facing Queen, which had probably been given it's last face lift 15 years ago, and which for some reason had sheets that smelled like cigarette smoke. I complained the following morning about the smell of the sheets and was promptly offered free breakfast in their cafe (which makes a really good coffee btw) and given another room (which is why my rating is higher than it would otherwise be). I then spent three nights in a room at the back, facing Price Chopper, which was very quiet and very clean, but nothing to write home about. At least I got three night's decent rest, but I still found it a bit on the pricey side considering the size of the rooms, the hotel's location and the fact that the rooms were in need of a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “artistic design of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: laynepease
Reviews.Content: It was such amazing stay here in Gladstone hotel, specially the lobby so fantastic and full of art designs. It was just nice to look at. Rooms are well appointed, very clean and satisfying. Service at this hotel is great, friendly staff as well. Great taste of foods. Just enough for the money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great funky-art-boho boutique hotel in West Queen W/Parkdale.”
Reviews.Author: LittleFishHalifax
Reviews.Content: loved my stay here - just a quick overnighter, I am a former Torontonian and was happy to stay out of the tourist area especially over Christmas. Quiet hotel, excellent location for having a unique and hip Toronto experience - easily accessible to Parkdale, Ossington St, and Roncesvalles neighbourhoods. Comfy beds, awesome morning cup of coffee, funky helpful but not overly effusive staff. Good service in the bar. Old style elevator. Only complaint is that if you have a lot of luggage, clomping up and down the stairs is a pain. You can easily have the staff ring the elevator, but that was too much of a bother for me. Rooms are small and location is also not central (although its Toronto and right on a streetcar route so what's the problem?) so these could be issues for some. I liked the artsiness of the rooms, but have seen more creative and funky decor. It wasn't quite my aesthetic but this isn't a complaint. Room was airy, peaceful and perfect for a night or two. It is just that in spite of the art, the rooms are pretty sparse. Overall, really liked.

Reviews.Title: “A boho chic hotel with all the modern luxuries one needs!”
Reviews.Author: Thaidreams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rang in 2012 at the newly renovated Gladstone Hotel! We arrived early, so our room was not ready just yet. The front desk clerk offered to hold our things while we had breakfast in there cafe and gave us a 10% off coupon. The food was superb and very responsibly priced. After about an hour our room was ready and the clerk came back to the cafe to take us upstairs. We were on the fourth floor and enjoyed our ride in the 100+year old elevator. This is the only elevator in the hotel, so guests staying here should be prepared to take the stairs. If you know that making multiple jaunts up and down the multiple flights is not for you be sure to ask for a room on a lower floor or just come with the mindset that you will need to wait for the elevator. The staff at the Gladstone is more than happy to run you up and down. Free wifi hotspots are all over the hotel and the service is very fast. This was perfect for us as we used it to make FaceTime calls to share the hotels art work to family that couldn't make the trip. We stayed in room 407 and found the atmosphere the artist created to be extremely tranquil. The tv and dvd player were stored in antique luggage. When the sun was out, we loved waking up to it streaming through our bedroom window. It was very difficult to checkout of our little slice of Eden! As comfortable as the Glastone makes your stay you will want to see the city of Toronto. It's very easy to catch a cab or street car (stops are right in front of the hotel). Again, the staff at the Gladstone does a superb job of giving directions and local suggestions on things to do and see in the area. I hope in the very near future to return to the Gladstone and to bring more family and friends with me. It's the perfect getaway for art lovers who enjoy staying someplace out of the box.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2012”
Reviews.Author: haaginheimer
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, great location, fantastic new years party and just a great vibe from everyone there. located in the heart of the arts district was a short walk to various shops and easy access to museums and CN tower downtown. the 1800s elevator and porter who operated it always had a story on hand and the local art throughout the hotel was great conversation starters

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on west queen west”
Reviews.Author: Mikedsn
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel with great staff in a non-tourist funky area. I live in the City so I did not find the street noise bothersome, in fact it was quieter than where most other hotels. The bed was one of the most comfortable i have ever slept in. I loved the old style cage elevator. If you are expecting a business hotel, this is not the place for you, however if you want to be surrounded in art and stay in one of the trediest parts of the City I would definetly recommend this hotel. It is only 20 minutes by streetcar to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Target Red”
Reviews.Author: Sethb123
Reviews.Content: After checking in, we went up in the operator-only beautiful old elevator to our room. Opening the door it was completely done in Target red with knitted butterflies in boxes on the walls. Very interesting to say the least. Room was very comfortable and the art and orientals in the hallways were very nice. Shower was the tiniest I had ever seen, with a bathtub spout sticking out about a foot from the bottom. We liked the quirkiness. Could hear a little street noise but it wasn't bad. Second night, though, we had to adjust the shutter in the transom above the door so a little less hallway light came through as that had confused our sleep at night....however the drapes and shades did such a good job of keeping out the daylight that it was much later than expected when we got out of bed. Melody and Art bars were hopping with country music and later, karoake. Staff at the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. Definitely not a chain hotel experience but fun. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. Reminded me of my favourite of times past, The Hotel Chelsea in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Gary P
Reviews.Content: Design of each room, the restored classic bohemian hotel, the great bar, the fantastic cafe and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing decor and average service at best”
Reviews.Author: elle0ny
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to staying at this hotel for a long time, but was disappointed with the quality of service and decor. Here are some of the highlights: Pros The art gallery had wonderful art and the location of the hotel is in the best part of the city. The free morning coffees delivered to your door were also very much appreciated, as was the comfy bed. Another great advantage was the free wireless in the rooms. Cons The decor needed some sprucing up. The armoire door in our room was not hinged to the unit so that when I opened it, the door fell off of one of the hinges completely. The bathroom had some sort of tape that was used to create a decorative stripe across the walls but it was peeling away from the wall on the door frame (probably due to the moisture). Both the armoire and drawers/chest were placed on stacks of hardcover books to increase the height of the furniture, I'm guessing to match the scale of the room's ceilings, but it just looked tacky. The front desk staff were okay (check-in person was great) but some of the staff were a bit curt and only offered a minimum level of service (they made me feel like they were doing me a favor by doing their job). For example, the elevator requires an operator and there was never anyone there who was always available to operate it. You had to ask for someone, and when someone came, it was always like we were a pain for asking to use it. Consequently, we used the stairs while we were there. Check-out was the worst because the guy was super slow checking in another guest and chatting it up with her even though I was visibly in a hurry to leave (with my suitcase and everything). He did not apologize for dawdling and ignoring me, and it just left a horrible impression of the hotel. The bartender in the hotel bar was also slow to serve and did only the very minimum level of service. This is all while serving two other patrons in the entire bar. Just very odd. In a nutshell, this hotel is more for the kind of folk that like 'vintage' furniture from Salvation Army, don't mind paying boutique-hotel prices but not getting the usual corresponding attentive service, and don't need hotel robes or slippers. I will check out the Drake or other hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “my all time favorite!”
Reviews.Author: EstherWorldTurns
Reviews.Content: Last April I stayed at the Gladstone and it was really delightfull: the decoration of the rooms, the people working there, the coffee in your room in the morning, the art in the vestibule, good food, fun gigs in the bar, the location in the best part of town.... I'm hoping I'll be able to visit Toronto and the Gladstone in the near future again! (already recommended to everyone who wanted to hear!)

Reviews.Title: “The most hospitable and hip hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Siddrix
Reviews.Content: If you like art, charm, character and history the Gladstone hotel is exactly what you are looking for. Our room was cozy yet clean but never mind those details, the Gladstone was about sheik hip creativity with outstanding service, free morning java delivered to you room and friendly staff. But if you are looking for a spacious room in a quiet location you may be better off looking somewhere else. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay for vegetarians and those with accessibility needs”
Reviews.Author: BizzTravlr
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Gladstone, and I traveled with friend. One of us is vegetarian, one of us is gluten-free, and one of us is visually disabled. In addition to the fantastic service, atmosphere, location and feel of the building it was also a great experience in that we felt constantly well tended to with without imposing. The staff was 100% amazing. Every person we interacted with was respectful, pleasant, prompt and seemed proud to work here. Food was delightful. There were great spaces to recharge, people watch and socialize. They were also able to assist with every tourist need from navigating the public transit to dealing with the airport and finding great food in the area. The creative, artistic, modern-yet-historic personality of this venue flows through every detail, and it is rare to find that combined with unpretentious staff. Truly, this was an excellent stay and the value we received well exceeded the price of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else now that I've found The Gladstone!”
Reviews.Author: CPrimm
Reviews.Content: With 27 unique and artistically designed rooms and service that made me feel like I was at home, this was a fabulous "home away from home" and centrally located. Sunday brunch with a three-piece bluegrass band was an added delight and the 107 year old metal and glass elevator adds to this hotels remarkable charm. Will stay here every chance I get when visiting Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Gen A
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay. Friendly staff, beautiful room, and wonderful food at the Gladstone restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Design Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: I loved the Gladstone! Housed in a beautiful historic building, each room has been designed with care by a different local artist to create a unique experience for all. I really appreciated the care that was put into crafting a comfortable, well-designed environment, both in the room and in the public areas of the building, while still being able to keep costs reasonable. The art in the public areas was really fun and I loved that there were cool events happening each evening that I could pop into downstairs. The room I stayed in was small and the bathroom is tiny (more like staying in a European hotel), but it was perfect for me. The design was simple, but was effective in creating a calming ambiance. The food in the cafe downstairs was excellent - healthy, delicious and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blondie131313
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really fun and artsy. It felt like I had a trendy studio loft of my own. The people working there were very friendly and helpful. I would say the only problem was that when people came in late, it was very loud and the shower in the room I stayed in was VERY small. Other than that it was really interesting and I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Frosty reception”
Reviews.Author: NorthLeeds
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we found reception to be slightly frosty and unfriendly. You need the opposite after a long trip. The room was also slightly disappointing. We found it to be small and the design a bit half hearted with a very strange shower! It's beautiful old building but could do with a bit of warmth and character. Having stayed elsewhere in Toronto I'd recomend the hotel a couple of blocks east.

Reviews.Title: “Neat decor but small room and lots of street noise”
Reviews.Author: chavgopal
Reviews.Content: Stop in for brunch in the Melody Bar - great menu and fabulous food!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy and Home-y”
Reviews.Author: Emdee08
Reviews.Content: I loooved the artist-designed rooms! I stayed at 3 different rooms for the 3 nights I was in Toronto just to see the designs. They all were cozy and home-y! You can sometimes hear the guests from outside the room but it wasn't much of a bother. The elevator had to be operated by the hotel staff because it's a really old, manually-operated type. I liked it though, felt like being brought back in time. The hotel is close to nice little shops and cafes along Queen. Even caught Coldplay at the CTV lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice touches although very west”
Reviews.Author: bigron82
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in total and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Upon arrival we were helped to our room via the fantastic central lift, a working remnant of the historic building. We stayed in the Canadiana room which, whilst quite interesting, wasn't the most inventive interior design I've ever seen. However, the room was a good size for a major city and whilst the AC worked fine, it would've been nice if the windows opened a little bit. The shower was pretty terrible, as it didn't fully switch from the bath tap supply to the shower nozzle, but there was always plenty of pressure/hot water. Free coffee delivered to your room is a nice perk, and the dry-bar in the room has some really nice stuff, if somewhat overpiced. The location is VERY far West and, as someone who like to walk cities, it's quite a trek from anywhere central, but the hotel can't change this and I should've realised prior to booking tbh! Overall, it's a well designed hotel with some nice features in a great building. If you're driving, don't mind cabs, or are happy on the streetcars then the location is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Gladstone! More like Flintstone Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADK64
Reviews.Content: The rooms although nice are very cramped, the AC is more of a white noise generator than a cooling system. Which incidentally was its only saving grace as the friday evening we stayed there was LOUD music until 3AM that carried up to the third floor. The bass was so deep i think I lost a filling. The bathroom frankly was more of a closet with water in it. I have used telephone booths with more elbow room than was available in the shower. My biggest fear was closing the shower door only to emerge half man half fly. If you want ICE then you may as well forget it. I called down three times for a bucket of ice and never received it. All in all I would rate this experience a very poor one. The Restaurant also was disappointing I ordered a Stake Medium well and after it being returned it still came back the same. Money better spent in another Hotel. $220 a night is very steep and I don't think we really got any sense of value our hard earned US Dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic hotel that forces you to slow down”
Reviews.Author: abramsma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were in town for our wedding. We chose this hotel because it is artistically unique and offered a great spot for some wedding photos. We stayed in the "Best Room" which was nicely decorated, small and clean. The best thing about this hotel is the atmosphere. The front desk staff weren't overly friendly or helpful, more indifferent. The restaurant bartender was super friendly as was house keeping. They don't seem to have air-conditioned rooms as we had a stand alone unit in our room which was loud and wasn't able to keep up with 6 girls getting ready on a hot september day. House keeping didn't take away our dirty dishes when they cleaned our room. They left stale food sitting on dishes, so we just put them outside our door. We had breakfast in the bar twice, and it was really slow but the food was worth the wait! We observed other tables complaining to staff and even getting up and leaving. You have to wait for someone to take you up in the lift and there is not really anywhere for you to pull up and unload easily. Even with all of these inconveniences you can't help but realize that this might be by design and maybe instead of trying to rush around you should relax and admire this beautiful building and the art! We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Gladstone Anniversary Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: the_duiks
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT 20th Anniversary Getaway and stayed at the Gladstone. Staff and service were EXCELLENT!! Very helpful and courteous. Rooms were unique and very clean. My only complaint would be that they did not do something "special" for us knowing that it was our 20th Anniversary Getaway...I had read of other hotels that will do at least something for guests celebrating a special occasion and was hoping for something...but does not deter me from writing a great review for the Gladstone. Rooms and beds are very comfortable and clean!! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Arts and Bikes”
Reviews.Author: jmdapozzo
Reviews.Content: Bikers and Art lovers, looking for a special weekend? Wait no more; reserve your stay at the Gladstone hotel. Right in the art district, you will be a few blocks away from the major museums and lovely galleries. Feel like biking, just hop on your saddle and pedal to the lakeshore and enjoy! Best of all, you wont need to keep your carbon bike on your car rooftop; the Gladstone staff will shelter your beloved bike and keep it safe and sound. Just ask!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripinator
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a family wedding. I got to see many of the rooms, all of which are uniquely designed. They are all pretty small, with some better than others. The service was great and the wedding went off without a hitch. The hotel itself is a cool piece of Toronto history with the oldest operating elevator in the city. Great food and nice cafe for reasonably priced breakfast. It's a little off the beaten path in terms of location, and the area isn't great, but it's up and coming. Definitely a great place for a wedding, especially if you're a hipster.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: You don't exactly receive drive-up greeting by a bellhop waiting to help unload your luggage, nor is there complimentary parking in an obvious location...but this hotel definitely has artistic details that matches no other. Staff at reception and elevator operator(s) were very friendly and helpful (you cannot operate elevator yourself as it's an old-fashioned 'cowboy-style' lift!). Rooms are delicious! Every detail from the wall coverings, very cool curtains, artistic lampshades, art-deco chairs and far-out 'chandelier' made the in-room experience a fun one! Unfortunately spotted a big earwig (bug) crawling along the floor just before sleeping which was more than a little disturbing and made my experience a 4 which would otherwise be a satisfied 5!

Reviews.Title: “Little "different" but lovely!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinH_11
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Toronto that is a little bit different, you definetively have to Chose the gladstone hotel! The rooms are all differently designed and the stairways and hall have Contemporary Art all over. The bathrooms could Be bigger and have more comfort but that does Not really matter. Everything is clean and the stuff is very helpful and friendly! Don't miss the chance to eat in the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Another loverly stay at the Gladstone!”
Reviews.Author: natureexpl0rer
Reviews.Content: We are repeat customers at this artistic hotel in Toronto. During this trip, we had the luxury of staying in the prestigious Tower Suite which was a real treat - soaring ceilings, two floors, two bathrooms, kitchenette and best of all, a large comfortable bed surrounded by windows and views of the city in all four directions. Very cool and very romantic! I would definitely stay in this room again. It was uplifting and inspiring - a room I would consider living in! On top of that, the service at the hotel was amazing. The personnel went out of their way to welcome us and make our stay perfect. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the beautiful Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: LazydaysGanderNL
Reviews.Content: My dad used to visit the Gladstone 50 years ago.....says it's upscaled from his days! We booked 4 nights downtown as part of a month long holiday. Having liked the previous stay we didn't hesitate to rebook at The Gladstone. We will return next trip to TO. Check in was friendly and welcoming and the trips up and down the antique elevator provided opportunities for employees to greet you again, inquire about your trip or encourage you to attend events at the bar or one of the two art exhibit opennings while we were there. you push the elevator button and employees round different corners to ferry you to your floor. Meals were delicious and we had 3 breakfasts, 2 lunches and 2 dinners on site. We walked to the Drake for one breakfast and while the meal was good, it did not have the ambiance or personality of the Gladstone. We stayed in the Canadiana room which although not huge, is designed to give that impression. the bed is low to the floor making the ceiling and deer antler chandelier seem that much further up. large windows offered a view of old and new Toronto and the streetcar which we used and enjoyed. Ear plugs are provided but we found our room very quiet, even when there was music on the floor for a gallery opening. We enjoyed a band on Sat night that sang hits and misses from the 1950's and original music in a rock-a-billy style. This was followed by the famous Melody Bar kareoke. Rooms were spotless which is a lot more difficult when each room is unique. In a cookie cutter hotel you just have to follow and repeat the same ritual. Here, attention is paid to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Quirky, Cool!”
Reviews.Author: rdooz
Reviews.Content: Chose the Gladstone after coming across it online. What a terrific find! Excellent accommodations, with artist-designed rooms, the quirky (but functional) Cowboy Elevator, art gallery, dedication to sustainability, and first-rate service. The Gladsone isn't for everyone, but it you want a hotel with character, and a stay you'll remember for all the right reasons - then the Gladstone is a perfect choice .

Reviews.Title: “neat, cool hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloTex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gladstone on a recommendation. Neat hotel! Our room was small but very comfortable (A/C was a little noisy.) There is a lot of fun art on the walls in the common areas. Staff is very knowledgable and helpful. Cafe in hotel is great for breakfast. Your are in a good spot to explore Queen St. West. The street car is right out in front, giving you easy access to the entire area.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: CaryAllison
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for three nights thanks to the institution that invited me to Toronto to participate in a conference. First of all, this place is unique and way cool--a hipster icon in Toronto no doubt. Each room is completely done by a particular artist, and you can get the entire list of who did what room in the lobby and at the bar. There's also an art gallery on one floor and lots of public art in the communal spaces. Really cool old period elevator to get you up and down. And the bar is definitely one of the best hotel bars anywhere--and an acknowledged hipster spot in the entire city. It also--FYI--has very good food. The Gladstone is in one of the cooler and edgier neighborhoods in Toronto, and the hotel is a gathering place. So this means that there can be quite a scene in the larger bar/restaurant on the other side of the lobby, with live music, etc. If you turn in early or are a light sleeper, this might not be for you, or you might want to check first with the hotel about specific room assignment. My room was basically over the main entrance and, well, I just chilled and went with it. But be advised. With that proviso--I think it's great what they've done with this old, historic hotel. Beautiful, funky, imaginative, bohemian--and with great food and drink!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique style albeit slightly out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JonAntony
Reviews.Content: this was a great place to stay for the two of us. Hotel decor was fun and the staff were quite accomodating. There isalso a small restaraunt in this hotel that had great food However, for us it was located a bit off course in the sense that is is not subway convenient. Further, because this is an old historic hotel, the rooms were small, coupled with a small bathroom. I do believe you can upgrade to a larger room but none was available at the time I reserved. As the elevator is original to the hotel, it must be staff operated. At times we had to wait for someone to attend to this. Our other choice was walking 3 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique hotel on Queen West”
Reviews.Author: CathleenJames
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the gladstone Hotel and had a great experience. The hotel is an old (early 20th century?) low rise bulding and includes a restaurant as well as a lounge for music; the hotel also hosts many art shows and the art is scattered throughout the hotel. Check in was friendly and I asked aobut my room location because some of the rooms can be noisy; I was given a room in the back which was quieter. The room itself was cool and welcoming; nice bed, pretty good lighting. The room also came equipped with earplugs. There was no formal workspace so I worked on the bed using the hotel wirelss - not a big deal for one night. The washroom ws small but immaculate and the room generally reminded me of boutique hotels in Europe. I usually stay closer to downtown but I found the streetcar service was frequent and stopped right in front of the hotel. The front desk also called me a cab when needed. The restaurant opens at 8am so if you're an early riser, you nee dto get dressed and walk cross the street to the 24 hour restaurant or head a few blocks east to the Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “The Gladstone Hotel is a neat experience”
Reviews.Author: mtlbaltdan
Reviews.Content: Each room is artist-decorated (in my room, this included cleverly-painted bedroom AND bathroom) which gives this hotel a certain cachet. There's an old-fashioned elevator with cage-like doors; fun for the novelty, but I tended to take the stairs even though I was on the fourth floor, as I really don't like to bother employees each time I decide to go in & out (and believe me, I had no *clue* how to operate that elevator). Overall a fine experience: my room was not soundproof as I could hear a woman's voice and the clomping of women's shoes in the hallway, but didn't really bother me for long. More than the art displayed, for me, the frequent streetcars and active street life on Queen Street West nearby is to me the big draw of this hotel: its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: deborah12
Reviews.Content: The rooms are on the small side but they're so charming it doesn't take away from the appeal. The service we received was impeccable. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “love this original spot!”
Reviews.Author: gal1
Reviews.Content: Each room has a unique theme and design. It is very affordable and located on Queen Street where you can walk for miles and take in all the unusual shops, cafes and people. The restaurant has excellent food, the rooms are clean and fun. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Crap service, room never cleaned, full of attitude, lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: shmoelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our 1 year old baby for 5 nights, during which time the room was not cleaned once. The room was smaller than it looked on the photos. It's not a great location for families, noisy & hot and slightly dodgy. Breakfast was supposedly available at their restaurant but we waited one hour past their posted opening time and were still unable to be served due to slow/asleep/hungover service. Ever tried waiting an hour for a bowl of muesli with a hungry child? Impossible. At the end of our visit, we were charged 20dollars/night for the baby's crib, a charge which was not listed anywhere. We had booked through booking.com and the management more or less treated us like lesser human beings for having gotten a discounted room and therefore felt the crib charge, which was not listed on the booking.com info, was fair play. Booking.com chose not to post my review of the hotel when I complained about it. I liked the idea of the organic homemade toiletries, but in reality they left my hair and skin feeling like straw (and we are a 100% organic use household). The bed made me feel itchy. Seeing that the room was never cleaned the entire time we were there, I don't even want to think about why. The positive of this hotel is that it has lots of personality. The downside is that it is really not up to standard, and certainly not for the prices they think they should be charging. Very snobby for Toronto, which is where I grew up and I'm used to better service and more respect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jolie_yoli16
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone Hotel is a unique experience in a great neighborhood. The historic hotel is part art gallery, part top-notch restaurant and part local pub. Each room is designed by a different local artist. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable, especially after a long day exploring the city by foot. The front desk staff is so friendly and accommodating. They seemed to be genuinely interested in our satisfaction with our stay at the hotel and in Toronto. They were kind enough to give us breakfast vouchers and a discount coupon for dinner (not originally mentioned in the amenities list) and to offer suggestions on what was going on locally. West Queen West is an exciting neighborhood, filled with art galleries, restaurants, bars and shops. I can't wait to get back to Toronto and to the Gladstone Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and room, amazing location for nightlife and shopping”
Reviews.Author: katherinet1982
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, very clean, lots of space and storage despite small room size. Interesting art gallery in hallway of each floor. Interesting hand-operated lift. Right next to streetcar stop and so many restaurants and bars and shops on its road and neighbouring streets. Our oom even had a view of the CN tower and city skyline.

Reviews.Title: “You will either love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: ekuni_mai
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the "Model Citizen" room, a vibrant peacock-themed room. Loved all the unique touches - artsy feel of the hotel, old-style elevator, moisturiser and shampoo bars in the toilet. Great breakfast in the cafe downstairs too. Room was a little small but still big enough for me and my friend to get dressed comfortably for a wedding we were attending. Liked the hangout areas on each floor where we could chill with other wedding guests instead of having to go all the way down to a lobby downstairs. Near to galleries, cafes and unique shops, but unfortunately have to pass through a very short block of slightly disturbing homeless people on the way - just have to keep your head down and walk confidently through.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and hip without the attitude!”
Reviews.Author: shoeshiny
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Gladstone while in Toronto for a business trip. I was sick of staying at the soulless business hotels downtown so took a chance on the Gladstone. I'm really happy I did! I have to admit it felt a little sketchy walking in since the block felt a bit gritty at night, but don't be deterred. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by Ricardo who was very smiley and charming. The vibe is very unique and has tons of character. On one side of the lobby is a performance space that was having an open mike night. I later heard they have the best karoake in town. On the other side is the bar/restaurant. You definitely feel a lot of history walking in and it's been renovated in an artistic, funky style. We took the elevator up to our rooms - it's an old school elevator and needs the operator to bring you up/down. It's quite small so if you don't like confined spaces you might take the stairs! On each floor is a security door to all the rooms and a meeting space with lots of chairs that you can hang out with friends/colleagues. The hotel does do a lot of events so I appreciated that added level of security since lots of non-guests might be wondering around the open spaces. I had what was considered a bigger room and it was quite small - but it totally didn't matter! As you've seen on the site, each room is designed by a different artist. I walked in and felt like i was spending the night inside a gallery - super cool! I was in the Racine which had an amazing mural behind the bed and lots of the fixtures had the themes of "roots" - just like the name of the room suggests! One wall has a lots of little mirrors and the TV/DVD are hidden inside a huge stack of vintage suitcases. Bathroom was kind of dim but in the morning i just used the mirrors in the main space. I had a friend with me who stayed on a cot while I slept in the bed. It was pretty tight - but again - totally worth it, especially given the artistic vibe and the incredible room rate! We took the stairs up and down after our first trip up the elevator and got to walk through the literal gallery space on the second floor - a photo exhibit was taking place during our stay. Had drinks/dinner at the bar. delish. In the morning, I could see the train tracks and GO train which I felt added to the cool urban feel the place has. If you're a super light sleeper, the trains might wake you up so maybe ask for a room that faces another direction. I had some downtime the next day and really enjoyed walking out the front door and going up/down queen st west which has boutique after boutique and restaurants/bars/coffeshops aplenty. Must be said that the location is a bit far flung if you need to be in downtown, but just give yourself more time to get to your meetings - you'll feel like you took a little vacation and not just a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “This room tops the Romance Richter Scale...”
Reviews.Author: jtorti7
Reviews.Content: Want to score high on the Romance Richter Scale? The Gladstone is an indulgent, urban experience with a colliding vibe of history and architecture in sexy spaces designed for couples wanting a cozy crash pad with a focus on the finer details of a hotel stay. Coffee arrives on your doorstep at your requested morning hour, there are gourmet snacks to pillage in the room, ice delivery if need be (and it will be needed for the champagne!). The soaps are hand-milled from Prince Edward County and there is even a shampoo bar. There's an ipod docking station and a stillness to the room that was surprising given the original wood floors and age of the hotel. Though we wandered down the street to the Drake Hotel Raw Bar for carb coma-inducing mac n'cheese and pumpkin stuffed ravioli, the Gladstone menu card spills over with indulgent choices too. The staff are bang-on with service, smiles and privacy. As a Toronto resident, I was transported to many places. Quebec City? Chicago? San Francisco? The rates are phenomenal for the luxury exchange. There will be a return visit, this has already been determined. Each room is a unique microcosm of design--check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Arty and fun! A very different hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: 2Beavers
Reviews.Content: Although very familiar with The Gladstone as an event and cultural space, this was our first overnight stay. Absolutely unique artist-designed rooms: we stayed in Allyson Mitchell's "Faux Natural" and loved the fun-fur mural (which was immaculately clean). Friendly and practical service makes up for lack of typical hotel-chain amenities; like free, great coffee delivered at the time you choose instead of in-room coffee-makers. Probably not for everyone, but great for interesting people who enjoy a break from cookie-cutter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Room was tiny but inviting and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SouthernOnt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gladstone for an wedding that was hosted in their ballroom. The "Felt Room" was tiny at only 185 sq ft but spacious enough for what we needed. A friend of ours stayed in the room on a cot also that we arranged between the bathroom and our bed. Sleep was very peaceful because it was very quiet in the hotel (despite our rowdy wedding guests)! We even got a late checkout! Staff was very gracious, especially the wait staff and bartender in the ballroom. Very neat decor not only in the rooms but the entire hotel. Restaurant in Lobby served a great breakfast for a fair price ($12.95 for bacon and eggs). The best part was after the wedding we took the original 1907 elevator up to our room and went to bed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: measure3.1
Reviews.Content: The Bride and Groom chose the Gladstone for their Rehearsal Dinner and rooms for out of towners [including themselves and ourselves] for their July wedding and I did the booking. The Dinner was a great success thanks to Penny Rose, outstanding food and drink and splendid waitstaff. The carefully chosen rooms [402,404,418] got high marks both for design and comfort. Our room [402 the Victorian setting] was so interesting we had a tour after the Dinner for interested guests - it was a hit. As others have noted, the building has many beautiful attributes, e.g. the wide main wooden staircase, winding around the glass antique elevator is stunning. A great hotel needs a great staff and the Gladstone has stellar staff. The Front Desk is professional yet kind, the supervisor, Byron who checked us both in and out and his staff are willing to go the extra mile - e.g., Ricardo advising me on a room choice for my sister and Kara looking up needed internet information. We had a number of meals in both dining areas and all the waitstaff were attentive and enthusiastic. Outside the hotel: 1) across the street is the Gladstone Cafe which solves any coffee, tea, snack needs 24/7 and 2) the Queen Streetcar which runs frequently, stops in front of the hotel going west and the stop directly across the street going east will connect you with any place the TTC goes. A fun area going east is a few blocks north of the Spadina Ave. stop - here you will find Chinatown, Kensington and the Art Gallery of Ontario - art, shop, eat - to your heart's content. Yes, the Bride and Groom made an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, warm, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: DharmamamaOntario
Reviews.Content: This place has everything for the more adventurous traveler! The uniqueness of the rooms, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the lovely cafe/bar and the wonderful elevator! It's an art gallery/hotel/entertainment centre all in one. Some poor workmanship in some of the finishes (the wainscoting in the cafe didn't quite cover the lath and plaster under it) and the bathroom in the room had inadequate counter space, plus the windows were dirty, but that was all small stuff, especially when you consider the age of the place. The architectural detailing was wonderful. The beds were very comfortable, and the attention to environmental concerns was great. Make sure you take advantage of the hand-delivered morning coffee...no more nasty "whitener"!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, the hotel itself was part of the experience of my weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Rob155021
Reviews.Content: will never stay in the big chains again! had a blast and can't wait to go back! it was eclectic, had atomosphere, amazing art!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and desirable venue”
Reviews.Author: Constanz
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. The suite suited our purpose perfectly. No complaints. Only thing was a bit noisy at night but other than that great location and awesome historical building.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-end stay at the Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: funkybrown
Reviews.Content: Had a great week-end stay at the Gladstone. The location is perfect and the staff is very friendly. Great digs too! And the latte at the cafÃ© is excellent. This is my kind of place. I'll definitely be back and recommend it to artsy travellers. My only tip: the building across the street is under construction, so its a bit noisy in the morning. Not for light sleepers. However everything else makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Toronto's design district”
Reviews.Author: Montreal97
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone is a lovely place to spend a night or two. Fantastic location: restos, bars, shops, public transit. Fun rooms. Good place for those seeking character. Rooms may be smaller than what you're used to in a big chain, but you're not really in Toronto to hang out in your room all day, are you? Fantastic service & great price. Room could use a few touch ups and minor fixes (bathroom door wouldn't stay open), but overall, great. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Like reliving a piece of old toronto without pretension”
Reviews.Author: krmz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FUN.. I thas one of the most inviting bars to end a day of exploring the city! My partner and I just spent 2 nights at the gladstone and loved every minute. Staff are friendly and accomodating. Rooms are tiny and European in flavor , if you are a large person the showers will be tough but for me the other positives greatly outweigh a tiny room..really how much time do you spend in it? The beds were extremely comfortable and staff so helpful. Food was excellent but menu very limited for dinner. Front desk helped us find restaurant for one of the most romantic dinners of my life. GREAT accesible street car stop RIGHT out front for exploring the funky shops of Queen ST. LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: “Super clean. Super great. Amazing old world vibe with modern chilled hipness.”
Reviews.Author: ralphalfonso
Reviews.Content: Location is in the new super hip Parkdale area. Lots of art galleries and funky shops and eating. Streetcar stops at front door. You can park in front of the hotel using metered parking.. Bathrooms are smallish in some rooms. There is a 24hr diner across the street as well as 24hr convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “Funky place!”
Reviews.Author: ACnD
Reviews.Content: If you appreciate design and like to wander off the beaten path, check this place out. The amenities are fairly simple but the hotel is clean, the staff is courteous and the place is altogether more interesting than most. The Gladstone uses local (!) products and the cafe breakfast was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Effort”
Reviews.Author: RSantos_15
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here that the rooms might be noisy and/or cold I immediately contacted the Hotel. I asked for a room that doesn't front Queen Street to minimise the noise and was easily granted that request. I also asked if there were space heaters in case the rooms got cold and was informed that there were and will be available for our use. After taking care of those two things, our stay was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “3 year anniversary spontaneous hotel night!”
Reviews.Author: Ashened
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gladstone Hotel was great. If you've never heard of it, its an old building that's been updated and made into a unique hotel where every room has a different theme by different designers. We stayed in room #304 (you can see all the different rooms to choose from on their website). PROS Service was great. Especially the man working the elevator! Room was very clean. Room was awesome and unique! Great for fun photos. Bed was the MOST comfy bed I've ever slept on. There are galleries on every floor, amazing artwork. Good breakfast downstairs in the morning. CONS The windows in our room weren't very well isolated. We could hear every car that passed, plus you could feel the cold air coming through. We slept with sweaters on, and there were lots of heavy blankets, so it didn't bother us much. But it would some people. NOTE: - On weekends, there are bands/dance nights on the main floor. If you are a light-sleeper, this may bother you. (didn't bother us) - If you are new to Toronto and don't know the area, it isn't really in the middle of shopping, restaurants, etc. You have to walk a bit to find dinner or shopping (lots of bars nearby, though) All in all, we had a great stay and would recommend the Gladstone to anyone who wants to stay somewhere unique instead of in a boring cookie-cutter room at a plain hotel. Great for a weekend away :)

Reviews.Title: “Parlour of Twilight”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLeesar
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I are both Torontonians who recently left the city. On our last night in Toronto, we stayed for one night at the Gladstone in the Parlour of Twilight room. I would highly recommend both the room and the hotel. The bed was comfortable, the bath products were both lovely and local and the food in the cafe and the Melody Bar was very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: brg816
Reviews.Content: If you love art and history, you'll love this hotel! It's full of beautiful details and artistic touches. And they have a morning coffee service - you fill out your order and leave it on your door and it's waiting in the morning at your specified time! The individually decorated rooms are just exquisite and charming. A lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, comfortable bed and great location!”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanCowgirl
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, loved the Gladstone

Reviews.Title: “Groovy little stay in Queen West TO”
Reviews.Author: bgv36
Reviews.Content: We liked the groovy indie spirit of the Gladstone. Lots of fun rooms with an artsy feel. The rooms are a little on the small side with a bit of an upscale dorm room feel, but luckily they had artists redecorate. For example, although small and a bit campy, the WHITE room is indeed white from the floor to the ceiling with whitewashed recycled art on the walls - since it's all white it gave the feel of a bigger space. The hotel room walls are thin so if your neighbour is noisy, too bad for you. The hotel did provide a package of ear plugs (lol) so it's aware of the issue I presume... The scene is young - really good for 20's-30's with a peace & love groove to their soul. The entertainment that night in the ballroom was a funny Burlesque show with a flexible sexual-orientation flavour... The hotel bar had karaoke the night we stayed. We're not big fans since it usually involves giving a drunk a mic to howl into, but then if you're into it, it was probably a good time since the place was packed.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NRID
Reviews.Content: The staff is so helpful (from a genuine interest in doing their jobs well) and went out of their way to attend to the little things. The hotel itself is a wonder for the senses. Very cool vibe. Great location. My room (Canadiana) was extremely comfortable and I never wanted to get out of the extremely comfortable bed. I felt totally at home. This hotel is a great antidote to the vanilla boringness of other boutique hotels. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ceasars!!”
Reviews.Author: kelster747
Reviews.Content: Overall a great experience. The hotel and rooms are gorgeous. The food and drink in the cafe were wonderful - the best Ceasars we've had in a long time. My only bug was having to pay 15.00 for parking. Beautiful place in fab part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garrethart1
Reviews.Content: No 'Big City Attitude' here! The Gladstone had really friendly and engaging staff. Rooms were unique and fun...no cookie cutter boxes with the same old crap. Even the elevator (circa 1900) was crazy and fun. Great food, music and decor and location are killer. Lots to do around the hotel. Try it out if you want something different!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel on Queen Street West”
Reviews.Author: JamieD26
Reviews.Content: I love this old hotel. Very cool, hip, and in a great part of town for evening fun. Right on the Queen Street car too - 10 minutes to downtown Toronto. The art in the rooms and in the wonderful upper floor lobbys is a gallery in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, Lovely Service”
Reviews.Author: Mexifro33
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto but my boyfriend & I were looking for a 'night away' for our anniversary. This was our 1st time at the Gladstone and we'll definitely we going there again. We knew where the hotel was located in terms of distance to downtown, so we weren't taken aback by the 10-minute streetcar ride to our restaurant that evening. Even taking a cab back on a busy Saturday night cost only $15 from the King Street entertainment district. We stayed in Room 405, The Parlour of Twilight. It was very romantic & had a comfy king-size bed. Although I could see why a business traveler might find this hotel a little unusual, the noise level (again, on a Saturday night) was not bad at all. We heard about 30 seconds of loud voices the whole night (there was a dance & karaoke going on) and it certainly did not warrant using the provided earplugs. PROS: - Gorgeous, unique room - Prompt, un-stuffy service from the front desk (we called for ice delivery & the elevator and both arrived in under 2 minutes). Everyone we dealt with was very professional yet laid back and friendly. - Quick and easy check-in & check-out - Lovely organic soaps, shampoo and moisturizer provided - The hotel itself is filled with interesting art (we took a ton of photos) - Great brunch in the cafÃ© (albeit slightly expensive). - Iron & ironing board available in my room to help recover my crumpled dress. - Amazing atmosphere & history in a beautiful building. CONS: - The shower in the room was TINY. I knew this from reading previous reviews, but I booked the room anyways because it was beautiful. That being said, it kinda sucks trying to avoid a concussion while trying to shave your legs (no bending over at all). The bathroom was fine otherwise. - I wasn't able to book that room online; I had to call in to specifically request it. On the website, it asks you to choose the room type and bed size and then it lists which rooms are available. Since this room has a king-size bed and the only options on the website were for a queen or double, Room 405 isn't listed as being available. I called in to ask about it and they were able to book me in right away. -Totally minor: There's a neon pink light fixture on the window of our room and it was not turned on for our whole stay. I loved it in the photos of the room I saw on the site & I was disappointed that it wasn't on while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED my Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheMagster007
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, friendly, great neighbourhood. Staff are super, food is homemade and the rooms unique! The Gladstone may become "my" place to stay for all my Toronto trips.

Reviews.Title: “It works.”
Reviews.Author: Gringoblanca
Reviews.Content: Gladstone Hotel has the nicest staff of anywhere I have stayed. That is a huge plus. The hotel is in a very historic old building and even sports a old hand-crank elevator. My first night I was in the Puzzle Room which I did not like. It was right above the karaoke bar and it was loud all night - on a Sunday! The bathroom is decent sized, but the shower is tiny! I am 5'5" and 130 lbs (slim) and I could barely turn around in the shower. When I washed my hair my elbows hit the side of the walls. I I asked to be moved to a quieter room for the remainder of my stay and was moved to the Canadiana Room. Much better. Large, normal-sized hotel room with a full bathroom. This hotel might not be the best for business as it is a party joint - lots going on all night, and as it is an older hotel, noise echos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: LuizItu_SP
Reviews.Content: Nice artistic rooms, very friendly crew, good neighborhood and easy access to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, excellent location and beautiful rooms. Authenticity.”
Reviews.Author: tourguide00
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 16 people to Toronto a couple of weeks ago and we stayed at The Gladstone. I dealt with Byron for our bookings, check-in and check-out, and all kinds of general help; he was always helpful, reliable and precise in his bookings and recommendations and all the information that he provided us with nothing short of perfect. All of the staff were great - we checked in early and they gave us a safe place for all of our luggage and when we returned from TIFF we found each person's luggage in their room. Nice. I dealt with all of the front desk staff and they were all always extremely friendly, calm, genuine and helpful. The location of Queen W. is perfect for visiting galleries, shopping and great restaurants. Close enough to the ROM, Kensington, AGO, etc if you like to explore a city by walking. Otherwise there is a streetcar stop right out front. The rooms are beautiful. I stayed in room 312 and it was perhaps the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. We stayed on the 3rd and 4th floors which each have their own shared sitting area, that provided us with a great place to sit together for brief chats before heading out or when returning from an event. Perfect for a group as we wouldn't all fit into one hotel room and liked to be able to meet and sit without having to commit to a restaurant, etc. I had a couple of meals from the cafe which were okay. Nothing extraordinary and the service was a bit slow... I did however have a couple of great meals within 5 minutes walking of The Gladstone so if you are a foodie you can find something delish nearby. My friends who live in Toronto were very happy to come and meet me at The Gladstone for a drink or snack. Nice to stay somewhere that your friends would prefer to meet you at your hotel than anywhere else - makes scheduling of events very straightforward!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously...the coolest place IÂ´ve ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: flowrider11
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic hotel! So unbelievable cool.....Every room is designed by a different designer..and therefor perfectly unique...the whole hotel is in a 19th century perfectly restored and atmospheric house with modern art galeries on every floor. ANd the area is good with great nightlife going on...and its just a 15 minute streetcar ride to Downtown Toronto and Eaton Centre. This is the place to stay in Toronto...and prices are just great too.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: jenniferludlam
Reviews.Content: Our daughter got married here on Sept 2 nd 2010 and also had a Vegan reception after then we partyd and danced till 1 am. The staff could not do enough for us it was fantastic. We stayed the night and we had 7 rooms booked,every room was different. The next morning we went down for breakfast and the food again was good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be improved”
Reviews.Author: ewin1
Reviews.Content: Great restoration job and very arts- friendly. However, the rooms should really have coffee makers in them. For me, a decent coffee first thing is a bottom line and for these prices, I was very disappointed that this was not an option. Also the restored elevator is lovely and novel, but it means someone has to stop what they are doing to operate it for you every time you use it. If you are not comfortable with someone having to interrupt someone, you take the stairs, which is a consideration if your room is on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian Hotel in the Bohemian Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by the people at the Drake Hotel as a good alternative down the road. And a good alternative it was. Both hotels have a bohemian flavour with the Gladstone Hotel having art exhibitions on the second floor and an active club in the ground floor. All the rooms have been designed differently by local artists which really is a different experience than all the similar looking hotels/motels that we had stayed at during our 2Â½ week holiday in the US and Canada. One evening we participated in a local food and wine/beer reception at the second floor which was a really nice experience where we, as a curious story, actually won tickets to the next reception. The hotel is located in Toronto West which is really a cool neighbourhood with small shops and restaurants. Next time around in Toronto we will definitely stay in this area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: foodingmusic
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Biker room ! Everything is super there People, food , ambient The area at first glance seem to be a bit far from center but there is the tram in front of the hotel and the best way to disciver Toronto and all its areas its walking so Enjoy it !!!

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend the Gladstone to anyone who is seeking a unique Toronto hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: treid83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tower Suite for my bachelorette party and it was a fabulous time! The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. It was the perfect space for this type of event.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Place to Stay with Outstanding Character, Service, and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorz
Reviews.Content: What attracted us to the Gladstone Hotel is that each room is designed by a local artist, making it stand out against your everyday large hotel chain. We spent 3 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was # 315, the Today Room. While it was small, it offered enough room for us to be comfortable. We loved the character of the room, especially the exposed brick wall. The bathroom was small, however the vanity in the room provided additional space for getting ready. The hotel provides local handmade soaps and shampoos which was very cool. The biggest drawback was the shower size; you could turn around in it and that was about it. The safe was dated and not large enough to hold my average-sized laptop. Our room was not on the street so was quiet, and the bed & pillows were very comfortable. The building itself oozes with character. There's an old-fashioned elevator that has to be operated by an employee. My husband especially loved that feature. The floors have an open sitting area you walk through to get to your room. Great service all around, from the restaurant to front desk to housekeeping. The people at the front desk gave us some good recommendations of restaurants to try and helped us out with tickets to the transit system and how to use it. The housekeeper was very sweet and greeted us with a smile and hello every time we passed her. Our room was always very clean. Two of the three mornings we had breakfast at the Gladstone. The serving sizes and prices were reasonable and the food quality very high, with most of their food being locally sourced. My husband and I tried the frittata, bagel sandwich, and granola, all of which were outstanding. They also offer freshly squeezed juices. On the last morning we made the mistake of trying Eggspectations downtown - enormous servings of tasteless food. We wished we stuck with the Gladstone afterward, where we got better food and service for the same price or less! Parking is available in a store parking lot behind the hotel. It was close and not too expensive. The location is in the artsy district of Toronto, which seems to be a developing area. We felt safe walking around there. It's right across from a streetcar stop which is convenient for getting around. If you're looking for a place to eat, the Local Kitchen & Wine Bar is within walking distance to the west and had outstanding food & wine. The Drake is to the east and has delicious poutine (fries with gravy) and an upstairs sky bar.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveWhitby_ON
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very artistic setting. All rooms are different. Mine was comfortable. Funny there are ear plugs on the desk, i did not need them. The street cars going by might bother some people but being an old converted building which they managed to keep the cachet I think the did a really good job. You don't go there for a 5 star setting, if you go there to be in a cozy and special place you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic hotel with motivated friendly young people for whom service doesn't stop at checkout”
Reviews.Author: Dutchrob01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked the "red" room ( 303) + mini fridge ( which you could rent since the room didn't have one, which we knew in advance)+ parking facility right next to the hotel.We loved the (not too large ) room which was indeed artistically decorated with emphasis on red. What struck us was that the room did have a flatscreen tv and a dvd/cd player, but not a coffeemaker, which was a pitty.In view of the location of the hotel (West Queenstreet, which runs from the beginning of downtown to the heart of it) there is a lot of traffic . Beside that there are lots of activities in the hotel bar(karaoke and music bands). We could hear all of that in our room, which was on the third floor. It took a little getting used to, but it didn't bother us at all. We considered it part of the vacation. It is a nice walk from the hotel to Chinatown on Spadina with lots of art galleries and small restaurants in Queenstreet. The staff was friendly and helpfull . Assistance with the luggage was no problem. The client centered service as a management philosophy was demonstrated when I discovered ( one hour after checkout when we were on our way to Kingston) that I had left my Ipod in our room. One phone call was enough for them to send it express delivery to our next destination where it arrived the next day. Which such an attitude one can be sure that this hotel will do anything within its power to make your stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “WouldnÂ´t stay again”
Reviews.Author: Marcelinha
Reviews.Content: When I made th reservation for Gladstone, I hear it was a design hotel, with different rooms, each one made by a different designer. I saw the rooms in their website and loved them. Although, the pictures are not real, the rooms are much much much smaller than they look like and completely different from the pictures. They are really tiny, ugly and the bathroom has a shoer cabinet so small that it looks like the one is a ship. The room they reserved to us had almost no windows and this terrible smell of cigarrete. I asked to chance it, what they did. The new room had only one window, that only had a fine curtain, what made me wake up at 6 in the morning every day, a great thing for a vacation. The room was also dirty, when I looked under the bed to pickup something that had rooled under it, I almost puked, it was absolutelly gross. There is no minibar in the room and they do not have room service, so if itÂ´s summer, drink you water mild!!! The toiletries are ridiculous, they offer you a shampoo, a soap and a wax (???) for the body in bars, they donÂ´t 'clean' and they donÂ´t smell nice. About the location, it is quite far from the city center, you cannot go walking to it, but there is a streetcar that stops in front of the hotel. They say they have a parking lot, but if fact they use the parking lot of the neighbout supermaket. They charge you 15 CAD a day to leave your car there, they do not help you take the luggage in and out of the car (you have to take it by yourself) and even if you paying for it, they ask you no to park 'in front of it, park behind it, not to take places from the customers', as the girl in the reception said me. The staff is quite nice, young people that try to help you as they can, and itÂ´s the only thing that we actually liked in this hotel. I would not stay there again and woulnÂ´t recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great food in a hip friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Auxiliary7010
Reviews.Content: As we were staying nearby at the IndexGB&B we had drinks and dinner here twice. The restaurant has great art and atmosphere, steaks are large and succulent and the puddings yummy. Service was attentive and friendly, the staff were interested in who we were and why we were in Toronto. One night we had a hen party on the next table and two charming men on the other, the result was great conversation. The adjacent bar had free live C&W one night and splendid bluegrass the next. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, romantic and hip- Gladstone Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannaHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: Unique decor, competent friendly great staff, nice restaurant with great coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MarijeTheHague
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. The rooms are very clean and hip. Maybe a bit small, but the high ceilings make it feel bigger. You just have everything you need! The hotel staff is very friendly and helpfull. And it is very convenient you can park your car at the supermarket parkinglot behind the hotel. There are many good restaurants and bars in the area. Don't forget the rooftop patio at the Drake, it's perfect! Small negative point: it can be a bit noisy because of the bar downstairs. Gladstone provides earplugs. Another option is just to explore the nightlife yourself because it's great!

Reviews.Title: “special , exciting , extraordinary , nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenstrip
Reviews.Content: its a place to feel good not just a hotel located at the center of live we have started our canada trip at this place and decided to finish at the same I wished I could have spend more time

Reviews.Title: “An original hotel, very service minded but they have an incredibly noisy air condition system.”
Reviews.Author: erikdangermoose
Reviews.Content: It's got soul and personality. I would stay here ten times before I had to go to a chain hotel. When that is said - if you're sensitive to noise then go somewhere else: The AC is like having a highway running through your room.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhondaZP
Reviews.Content: We stayed following a ski trip in BC where I unfortunately badly injured my knee, so we didn't get to walk the neighbourhood as planned. Pity. Looked like lots of trendy shops and galleries in the area. Stayed in compact clean Easy Rider room, room 302. Relied on the staff driven beautiful old lift, as stairs were impossible. Staff were friendly and willingly bought ice to our room for my knee. My would be biker hubby was impressed with the lamps made of bike helmets. See photo. Although our room was small, it was clean and comfortable. The corridors and lobby area displayed an exhibition of old warehouse photos. Enjoyed a great meal in the pub downstairs with a country band playing. Coffee shop was also good. Staff were helpful and offered advice on where to go. We bought our trolley bus tickets at the hotel before heading out for the day. One little gem we discovered is the Textile Museum. I thoroughly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “An experience, not just a room”
Reviews.Author: chrisboj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for his birthday, in the Parlour of Twilight room. Absolutely phenomenal. I want to go back just to see the other rooms! The old wood, elegant leather chairs and love seats on each floor, and the 100+ year old elevator make this place one of the most charming hotels I've ever been in [even after travelling all over the world]. The staff is extra friendly, the room was so clean, and the bed was super comfortable. A nice surprise to our stay was the Toronto Blues Society concert held on the Friday night. We arrived into it a little late, but it was so worth the couple of hours we spent dancing and drinking to some awesome tunes. The venue is small but it's not cramped - it's cozy and intimate. So awesome to stumble up the stairs into our huge bed after a night like that. The air conditioning saved our lives that weekend, and the cafe makes a killer iced latte. We really are blessed to have a place like this so close to home. Everyone should experience a night at the Gladstone.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, artistic rooms in a restored hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: ram1181
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic, the hotel is beautiful with an old, hand operated elevator featured prominently. My room faced the avenue, meaning it could get a bit noisy, but they helpfully provided ear plugs if necessary. It was also completely red, as in every single thing in the room was painted red, which I found cool, but others may not like. Overall, the hotel was clean, the service was great, and I found the room to be a bit on the smaller side but a piece of art in itself. Very cool place. The location is a bit out of the way, but the trolley easily takes you into downtown for two bucks.

Reviews.Title: “I would say awesome "climate" hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter_klodnicki
Reviews.Content: Hotel located at Queen st. West, Toronto. Not downtown but right inside fashionable boutiques, galleries and live-music bars area. Hotel service and waitresses at brekfast - really helpful and charming (breakfast - very tasty!) Not a best place for business meetings or business trips. Much more suitable for couples or individuals planning to see stylish shops and cafees. Highly recommended place.

Reviews.Title: “Cool style, tight quarters”
Reviews.Author: kholl24
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cool. The showers were small. The complimentary shampoo was a bar of shampoo and near impossible to use on my thick long hair. Other than that, I had a great stay and would come again, with my own shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Trip across town”
Reviews.Author: squirrel1972
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone is a great escape in the city. It is well located to hang out on Queen St West as well as the theatre district and more mainstream shopping, and has much more charm than most hotels. Overall the rooms are interesting and fun, but the beds are the best part.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame about the bed and the shower!”
Reviews.Author: leothegreek
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great drinks, food and the staff super nice and cool.... only complaints were that our left over margarita glasses weren't cleaned up, mattress wasn't great as it sagged in the middle and the shower felt like we were washing in a horizontal MRI machine! Opted not to say anything as we were only there for a couple of nights though would probably stay at the Drake Hotel next time we take a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: foodfan-5211
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Gladstone. We appreciated it's proximity to downtown with easy access to transit. It's a beautiful heritage building that has maintained its character. The hotel operaters work very hard at being "green." The staff was wonderful and helpful. The food in the cafe was excellent (and healthy) and mostly locally sourced. Our room (404), though small, was clean and the bed was comfortable. We were glad for the earplugs that were provided as it was quite noisy at night - they did the trick. The wireless internet was easy to access. Any time we needed the elevator, someone was quick to help operate it for us.
