We had a couple of issues (self-imposed) that staff helped us with cheerfully and quickly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Gladstone charms with a fun, offbeat elegance - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: girlonthewing
Reviews.Content: Like the area it's a part of, the Gladstone Hotel is many things at once - a great re-visioning of a heritage building; a part-time jazz haunt and photography venue (at least when we were there); a cool escape from the relative insanity of Toronto at rush hour; a fun and comfortable place to listen to friends and strangers warble with varying degrees of enthusiasm and accuracy at the (packed!) Melody Bar on its first floor. Even if karaoke isn't your thing, Melody is worth a quick visit on Fridays just to people-watch! That said, the fourth floor was high up enough that we didn't need the ear plugs (provided) even though our room faced out to Queen Street. Our room (Racine) was decorated using the theme of travel, of being lost and found in translation, and the artists' eye for detail meant lots of new finds. The audio "postcard" on the vintage radio, or the love letter silk-screened onto a cushion were cool, but the unusual TV stand made my afternoon. Unless your feet are killing you, skip the expensive bottle of in-suite wine and mosey down to the front desk; the folks there are great at pointing visitors in the direction of food, drink, art, dancing - as our concierge did, I'd recommend the Addis Ababa (?) Ethiopian restaurant about a block away if you're a little adventurous. Take in a bit of the street - by night or by day there's something to see - and then retreat back to one of the cool on-floor lounge areas or to your plush, comfortable bed for a good night's rest (forget the blackout blinds at your peril!) The bathroom itself is comparatively spartan, but all of the essentials are provided, and the local bath products are a neat touch! Food-wise, brunch at the Gladstone's cafe is sunlit, laidback, and delicious - the coconut chai latte is worth a try, too.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place, location, aesthetic, food â€“ but rude, slow, and difficult to work with”
Reviews.Author: AMACN
Reviews.Content: We booked the Gladstone for our wedding, and we stayed there for our wedding night. In many ways it was perfect: beautiful building, perfect location, just the right feel, and lovely food served. And the person we worked with in advance was great (if slow to respond, and even slower to follow through on the accounting). But our experience of the staff and service for the event itself was frustrating at best. Absolutely nothing was set up in advance (despite detailed instructions written by the hotel representative in the contract and order) and so we had to take care of that instead of getting photos taken. The staff was bossy and rude, and often ignored us. We had to pay for parking when we were told it would be free, we were scolded for a slight delay the cake-cutting (delayed because a guest had fainted and required medical attention), several of our guests were treated rudely and abruptly by service staff, and the following day during check-out the front desk simply left us hanging and started helping someone else. We eventually gave up, and left without a receipt. We've loved the Gladstone for a long time, but we will never again organize an event there, or recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Artsy comfortable spot”
Reviews.Author: yentl3
Reviews.Content: Loved our time at the Gladestone. Friendly staff, nice location and really interesting ambiance. We felt very relaxed and comfortable there. The hotel also houses 2 great restaurants that we found both full of good nightlife (but not too crazy) and YUMMY locally sourced healthy food. We were in heaven. A couple small downsides--our room was right on the front of the hotel (facing Queen St.) and it was LOUD. They were kind enough to provide ear plugs (who knew those worked so well?!), but if I had it to do over, I'd call and ask for a rear-facing room. Also, the room we were in (309) was very comfy, but had sharp corners on the edges of the bed frame. We both came home with several scuffs on our shins from cutting the corner too sharply in that compact room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...."interesting" rooms”
Reviews.Author: smemchitown
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a last-minute place to stay on the tail end of a business trip. I wanted to try something different in downtown Toronto, and the Gladstone caught my eye on this site. Although is was a little more away from the heart of downtown than I would have liked, it was a beautiful building with a great staff. I had the "biker" room....although small, it was still nice--and quiet. It made me want to go knocking on other guest's doors to see what the other rooms looked like. I especially loved the parlor-like design outside of the rooms. My only complaint was that the hotel bar closed very early (11PM) the night I was there :-(

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: caelatron
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone is one of my favorite places to stay in Toronto. The rooms are uniquely designed, and the staff is extremely helpful. If you're looking for a good night's sleep, make sure you reserve a room on a high floor and, if possible, facing the back or side. It can get quite loud on the sidewalks outside. Other than that small issue, The Gladstone is a wonderful place to stay, full of character & charm.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TeriCat
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer that has used the artist designed rooms for a couple of shoots, and yesterdays was in the Best Suite. Absolutely lives up to the name! Service as always was excellent. This time I got to spend the night and enjoy to enjoy breakfast there as well, and now, I love it even more! :) If you are visiting Toronto, or need a night away, this is where you NEED to go! :)

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels could be like this”
Reviews.Author: katiehlynsky
Reviews.Content: We were in Ontario to do a whirlwind trip --- 5 different beds/hotels within a week. After starting our trip at the Gladstone, I wished I did not have to leave. It was the only time I have stayed at a hotel where it felt like a home...only this home had art galleries, was in the perfect location for art/design/shopping/seeing friends/eating and had the most helpful and friendly staff. We will definatly be returning on our annual visit to Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Good location creative space”
Reviews.Author: SaganakiOpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 412 was clean and very bright. Everything worked out fine other than the pigeons on the ledge that started aroudn 5 in the morning. Was pretty tired so quite annoying. If you need rest quite a loud urban setting to say the least. The overall hotel is great for functions and the bar downstairs is a nice place for breakfast and a pint.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: jenjmeredith
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel--great location, tiny but accomodating rooms, and fabulous food. Only bad part? Local artist-crafted toiletries. Long hair and a "shampoo bar" do not go well together. Pack your own toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic, unique, and fashionable without comprimising comfort and quality service.”
Reviews.Author: dpawson
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone is a unique hotel, the history and rustic feel of the building takes on a life of its own with the artistic impressions of each room. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cool, funky!”
Reviews.Author: JonZ
Reviews.Content: Spotless room with a great mattress. Great soaps. Best hotel breakfast anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, unique, friendly hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: snugglebear82
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to the Gladstone for a surprise birthday gift and it certainly was a surprise. I booked the room rather late and so my room selection was limited to only 2 of the 27 'Classic' rooms offered, but I wanted a unique room rather than yet another typical "Howard Johnson" or "Best Western" plain, non-colorful room, so I took what I could get. From the location of the hotel, we weren't feeling overly confident that our stay would be very good...noisy Queen St. West in Toronto in not the prettiest part of town. But we stayed hopeful that inside would change our minds and it certainly did. Clean, classic 'old world' styling with art work and sculptures all over the place! Check in was easy and efficient with the staff super friendly and accommodating, even going as far as to remember I'd requested a more select room if one became available. Though no rooms had opened up, we were escorted up to our room in one of those super old elevator shafts where you can see all the mechanics involved and the safety gate closes over the door before going up - very fun!!! Our room was on the top floor which had a big central seating area with small couches and art work all over the walls. Our room was around the corner and not really knowing what to expect outside of the color-scheme, we said 'whatever happens, let's have fun!'. Our immediate reaction to the room was the size - very small....mind you, the giant king-size bed took up a huge portion of the room, so it was probably deceptive in size. The decor was totally retro - pink, purple, blue with a copper-gold tin ceiling. The bedding was satiny and sexy with a huge dark blue-gray velvet button head board running the whole length of the room. The bathroom was small but clean and the room had everything we needed for our short over-night stay. Had we been staying longer, we'd have definitely preferred one of the Gladstone's 'Gimme More' or 'Sweet Suites' room, but what we had was fine & fun for the one night! The hotel itself was super quiet...no annoying or noisy housekeeping waking up us at 8am, and even traffic was quiet with our room situated at the back of the hotel. The only noise was the air-con...a little rattly and a neighbourhood dog that wouldn't stop barking come 9am...but that's no fault of the hotel itself. The bed was comfy, had lots of pillows and definitely clean - no stains or funky-looking 'things' you find in other hotels. Perhaps the most pleasant part of our stay was that the entire building is smoke-free. As non-smokers, going into a room that has had smokers in it is repulsive. For the entire hotel to be free of stench, we were really impressed!! All in all, I'd totally be up for experiencing one of the bigger rooms at the Gladstone. Definitely hip & trendy and really not too far from the popular shopping districts of Toronto...by car, we were wherever we needed to be within 10-15 minutes (outside of rush hour traffic), and there were certainly lots of little eateries, bars/pubs right within walking distance. If you aren't looking for a huge hotel room and are up for trying new things, definitely check out the Gladstone. It's just a few doors down from the Drake Hotel, which also has a similar feel, but is considerably more expensive. Given some of the hotels I first looked at started at $475/night, for $165, we were happy with our stay at the Gladstone for sure and I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food, beautiful (but small) rooms”
Reviews.Author: AAGToronto
Reviews.Content: We were given a gift certificate for a night at the Gladstone, including dinner for 2 in the cafÃ© and tickets to the Factory Theatre as a lovely wedding gift. What a great chance to stay at a fantastic hotel in our own city! Every time we've eaten at the Gladstone, the food has been amazing. The rooms are so unique and beautiful. We were able to choose our room. My only complaint might be that the bed seemed a bit small for a queen. I could be wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: KawarthaGal
Reviews.Content: We recently moved out of Toronto to the country and went back last night for a 'night in the city'. What better place to stay than at The Gladstone? We've been to the Melody Bar dozens of times, but this is our first time staying at the hotel. We got a great deal online--- they put 2-3 rooms each night at a discount, so ours was $125, which really can't be beat for a cool boutique hotel in Toronto. We were looking at The Gladstone and The Drake, but this price couldn't be beat. Of course, the good price meant we didn't get to choose our room, but I requested a quieter room with a queen-sized bed and hoped that's what we'd get. We checked in around 3pm-- our room was on the 4th floor-- The Felt Room--- it was perfect--- bigger than I thought it would be--- contemporary and comfortable. The bathroom was small and unremarkable but spotlessly clean and just fine--- we were there to enjoy the city, not sit in the tub. The Gladstone has a great location for anyone who wants to be in the Queen West/Ossington area--- full of fantastic restaurants, arty-hipster bars and unique shops and galleries. The building is full of vintage charm and funky details (old elevator, etc.). The staff is super-friendly and seems genuinely happy to be there-- no phoniness whatsoever. The restaurant makes a reasonably-priced delicious breakfast with local ingredients. And on Thursday-Sat nights, they have the BEST karaoke bar in the world in the Melody Bar. Parking is a non-gouging $15/night. It all depends on what you're looking for---- if you want a huge bathroom, lots of quiet, huge hotel room, a more traditional 'hotel' experience and a more downtown location-- then maybe this isn't the right place for you. My only (very) minor 'criticisms' would be that the pillows were way too thick and puffy- ended up not using one--- (bed was very comfy). and there was also a big hum in the bathroom from the heating system--- we just shut the bathroom door to sleep- no big deal. Other than that we had a very quiet sleep--- they provide earplugs just in case. The whole place has a great vibe and we were 100% happy with our stay there--- will definitely stay there again when we go into Toronto. Love the Gladstone!

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: farrsie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend the night in Toronto just to "get away." We were actually going to spend the night in an expensive hotel in Yorkville, but my hubby came across the Gladstone. We are so happy that we decided to stay here. We felt like we were away from home, but not in a sterilized, artificial hotel. The whole place felt comfortable, artsy and unique. The room we stayed in was quite small, but it was very clean, and much cheaper than the expensive Yorkville hotel we were going to choose. Very simple toiletries and few luxuries were available in the room, so perhaps this hotel isn't for someone who needs those type of "things." Although the hotel does not seem to be in the best area at first glance, it actually has an eclectic group of shops, restaurants and bars just steps from the hotel. We had spent the afternoon on Queen ST. closer to Spadina, and wished we had realized what the Parkdale area (where the Gladstone is located) had to offer. Next time we'll spend more time there. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant, which was excellent and very affordable. I had the pasta puttanesca and my husband had the gaspe tourtiere. The live music was an added bonus which made our meal even more enjoyable. Breakfast was equally delicious, but cost about $30 for the two of us. Then we ventured out on to the street, stopping at about 6 different bars. I've never seen such a diverse group of people being catered to in such a small area. It was a great sight, coming from the dulldrums of suburbia. Our night's sleep was very quiet and peaceful. Our room faced the north side of the hotel, away from the street and we were on the top floor so I'm not sure what a south facing room might be like. People were out on the street quite late. Public transit stops right outside the hotel and will take you to the entertainment and shopping areas within 5-10 minutes. There is a grocery store right behind the hotel if you need anything. You can get a bucket of ice and a mini-bar in your room on request (although we didn't request them.) Overall we had a great time and will be returning for our next "get away."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Great Loaction”
Reviews.Author: kelpenhagen
Reviews.Content: Love the Gladstone - staff are great (friendly and v helpful). Great quirky vibe. Rooms are amazing and there is a great cafe downstairs. In a fab part of Toronto. I had half a day free on a business trip and it was a fantastic neighborhood to explore. realy recommend this place - definitely if you are not into "cookie cutter" chain hotels and are looking for a really unique hotel to stay in

Reviews.Title: “Hip Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dundie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Gladstone for 4 nights in 2 different rooms. Both rooms were small but cozy and well appointed. I loved artist driven decor in both rooms. Bathrooms, especially the showers are small, but clean and modern. The beds are comfortable and despite being a weekend nightlife hot spot, the rooms were quiet. The front desk staff and housekeepers wer always helpful and friendly. I loved the neighborhood. Queen Street is colorful, home to a ton of tempting restaurants (The restaurant in the Gladstone was very popular, but we never tried it), plenty of nightlife including 2 bars in the hotel, cute boutique shops, and hipsters. Lots of hipsters. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for traditional business travelers, but I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone traveling for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The Gladstone Hotel experience is like no other.”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad20
Reviews.Content: I have spent two relaxing enjoyable nights in the Gladstone Hotel. I couldn't wait to finish what i was doing in Toronto to get back to my room with a cup of hot chocolate and a book. I wish to make it through many more of the artist designed rooms, they are very intriguing . I have also purchased gift certificates for a staff member as I wanted her to emulate the casual friendly and accommodating front desk staff. All in all I would give the hotel a four out of five I would love to visit more often if only the specials were more available.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy vibe in a place wehere the patina has not been too polished”
Reviews.Author: Canadatom1
Reviews.Content: We like The Gladstone because it has not been overly "boutiqueified." They have not made it too hip (although it is quite a cool space). All of the staff treated us well, the room furnishings heighten your pleasure level and a drink or snack or some music are all available at the bottom of the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved the Gladstone & can't wait to stay next time I'm in town!”
Reviews.Author: dms96c
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay somewhere that wasn't your typical boring hotel so I search on-line. I was excited to find the Gladstone and even more excited about the price. It was a little loud because of the special event going on & the old windows, but so worth it. I stayed in the Canadiana room & got to peek at the Billio room where my colleague stayed. I can't wait to pick a different room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Everything the Royal York isn't”
Reviews.Author: GladstoneFan
Reviews.Content: On previous visits,to Toronto I have stayed in all the Downtown hotels. I've now stayed at the Gladstone 6 times in the last 15 months. Nobody wears a uniform. The vast majority of the staff are young ,and all are very polite and efficient. All the rooms are different and while not huge are big enough. Q st West is a local neighbourhood and while it's not Downtown, there is lots going on in the vicinity. The food is good as is the music and the art showings. Only downside would be if you are not enjoying the karaoke is to get a room at the back

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Suziepassa
Reviews.Content: Very nice people running the establishment, clean and very good food in Resto's down in the lobby. A little loud when the hotel is full, but over all great stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay at the Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: Radicalmandy
Reviews.Content: We booked room 316 for two nights and had a great stay. The bed was comfortable, the room was beautiful and the service at the front desk was phenomenal. The staff even went so far as to mail me a necklace I accidentally left behind. We ate breakfast both mornings at the bar and I maintain they make the best home fries I've ever eaten. I can't imagine staying at another hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the ordinary in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: mugats
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, charming rooms, very clean bathroom and comfortable bed. Good value for the neighbourhood, accessible to transit and parking, close to shopping, clubs and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Gladstone rocks”
Reviews.Author: Torontolovebirds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at The Gladstone to celebrate our anniversary. We picked it because of it's great location and incredible artist designed one-of-a-kind rooms. We wanted to be casual and laid-back and yet feel very special at the same time. Well, The Gladstone was the right choice! The moment we arrived we were warmly greeted at the front desk by a lovely adorable and charming young woman named Kira, who (upon hearing it was our anniversary) up-graded us from a room to the Tower Suite. It was a fabulous two story suite. The bedroom was in the tower itself and had spectacular views of the city in all directions. The decor was beautiful and everything was sparkling clean and lovely and the bed supremely comfortable. A perfect romantic setting for our anniversary. In the morning we really enjoyed our breakfast in the cafe (best eggs benedict!). Our waiter Matt was friendly yet professional. We particulary noticed how all of the hotel staff were dressed attractively and stylishly in their own unique style (just like the rooms!). A very friendly David made our check-out fast and easy. We would definitely stay at The Gladstone again and highly recommend it to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “if you are coming to stay in Toronto, the Gladstone is where you want to be...”
Reviews.Author: honeybe
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience! The rooms were both works of art and wonderfully comfortable. You could spend much of the day just hanging out in the cafe, wandering the halls looking at art or riding the birdcage elevator! The Gladstone is also situated in a very emergent neighborhood in Toronto where the past and present is honoured - new shops run by inventive designers, artists and chefs are framed in heritage style and offer a lot to the person who likes to window shop or better yet, spend. The Gladstone is a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic night”
Reviews.Author: hallander
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was prompt and friendly. Super comfy bed. Great artistic feel to the building and room. A bit on the luxury side, but great place if you can afford it. Least expensive room is smaller than the average hotel room, but if you want a unique experience you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I wanted!”
Reviews.Author: Antidoltist
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday and I wanted to do something solo for the day and enjoy the nightlife with my boyfriend. Smack dab in the middle of the art district, there was plenty to see/do/shop for the frugal artist. There was a lot of nostalgia being as it was just around the corner from where I grew up. The front desk was cheerful and accommodating. The room selection was just about the only thing that had me on the fence - So many designs and so little time! We grabbed a quick dinner at the lobby bar/restaurant where the food was tasty the service and atmosphere was laid back as groups of friends came to share a drink to end their work day/kick off their night. The gallery hallways were a great touch. The history and ambiance of this old hotel adorned anew in modern art and design was inspiring. The room though small was interesting and innovative and unique. For boutique it's far from stuck up. There's a welcoming, come in and have a good time vibe - though you probably should feel free to touch.

Reviews.Title: “carpeted wall of wood nymphs oh my!”
Reviews.Author: Kombugal
Reviews.Content: the room was awesome, eclectic, fun. very cozy! the staff are always very friendly and helpful. queen st. west rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent, design-conscious hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: oscarsmom12
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights, but was blown away by how beautifully this hotel has been renovated - with a focused eye towards clean, modern styling, without sacrificing any of the building's gorgeous old character and history. Our room (the "blue room") was brilliantly decorated, spotlessly clean, the delicious smelling soap in the bathroom was local and handmade (excellent!), and the cafe off of the lobby cooked up a mean breakfast sandwich (yum!). Simply a fantastic place to stay, and it's located at the top of Queen St West's seemingly endless coolness - bullseye! The only reason I give sleep quality a 4 out of 5 is because Saturday evening's raucous event on the main floor was a teensy bit distracting (to their credit, we DID receive ear plugs instead of chocolates on the pillows...) - but I will add that I actually loved the fact that the hotel had such a lively young social scene going on in the evenings... I'd gladly trade the vitality inherent in this hotel's atmosphere for the few extra minutes it took me to fall asleep. Well played Gladstone - I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel With Amazingly Unique Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jennytablina
Reviews.Content: My trip to Canada was a bit spur of the moment for a weekend with my boyfriend. We picked Gladstone based on reviews there and the fact it looked quite different to usual hotels. As a creative person myself I fancied the idea of a hotel with artist designed rooms! It's quite a way down Queens St. and thus quite a walk from the station. Though Queens St. has plenty to see along the way. Once we were there though we were given a warm welcome and our room was ready when we arrived. The rooms are not huge but have everything you need for a good stay, we appreciated the fancy soaps and the look of the room, everything felt fresh and clean. the TV had a good number of stations and the complementary wi-fi was great too! It was a little noisy due to the party that night but we were aware well in advance and the bed was so comfy that we felt asleep quite quickly anyway. We also attended one of the harvest evenings out of curiosity. At first it felt maybe a little too high-class for young adults such as ourselves but we had an enjoyable evening learning about organic farms around the area and sampling some wonderful foods from many places along with some lovely appetizers that made the rounds that evening. Certainly when we next come back to Toronto Gladstone will be high on our list. Thanks for being part of such a memorable trip to us!

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: MoonRiverRoundhead
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a uncrowded wed night and had read all the reviews on trip advisor previous to our stay. So yes i can say the room was small and it's not cheap. but since we knew that from trip advisor reviews, it didn't bother us. And because we had heard it can be noisy, we asked for a quiet room. we were put in 305 facing the price chopper grocery store. nice and quiet. couldn't hear queen st. noise or noise from the band. staff was very friendly and helpful. we loved the art/ambience and it was great for mini-vacation in the city. easy walking distance to lots of galleries and cool restaurants. had breakfast at the hotel..perfectly enjoyable. for whatever reason, couldn't get the wi-fi to work in the room. but overall, we enjoyed the hotel quite a bit and would go back when it's time again to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: toronto32
Reviews.Content: Its unfortunate, because I really liked this hotel the last time I stayed there, but there is a "deal" on the website saying that their classic room is $105 down from $165. So my girlfriend and I decided to have a nice night away, I called that day and asked if there were any classic rooms available and they said there is lots. When we got there, the host informed us that there are lots of rooms available, but the deal only applies to the first 4 rooms booked for that evening... how does that even make sense? I wouldn't have cared so much, but when I asked the gentleman if there was anything he could do, since there were so many available rooms and it was almost 9pm, we thought they would maybe make a deal. He looked around... considered it, and said no. I don't know about you, but I prefer to give a small hotel my business rather than a large chain, but when they act as if they couldn't care less about your business, thats cause for a walk out. Its really too bad, since that was going to be our staple getaway within our city.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with Style - Great Casual Service”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: Coming to town for the Interior Design Show, it seemed appropriate to stay at the Gladstone. Artist designed rooms and loads of character is right up our alley! We weren't disappointed. Our room was painted in the colors of twilight, with an enormous bed and a great custom neon grate on the window. We asked for a quiet room (there is a popular bar on the first floor and the second floor was hosting a design event) and they didn't fail us. Our fourth floor room on the back even kept us from hearing the streetcars (conveniently with stops in front of the hotel) With the door shut, we couldn't hear a thing and slept like babies. The cafe had lovely food and strong tasty coffee. Can't go wrong there. If you like a casual hotel with character in a fun neighborhood, this is your place. If you like a chain hotel with fussy service, a pool and a gym, this is NOT your place.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed at the Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: walterjones365
Reviews.Content: Right smack bang in the thick of everything exciting, cool and good, the Gladstone was a unique slice of home in a city I had never visited before. Great location. Brunch is good and so is the bar. The salty dark chocolate bars in the room are addictive. Lots of information in the hotel about what's happening all over the city. Look out for the magazine/ new stand at the door. Some very interesting art installations around the place and I love the idea that each room has a different theme. And the staff are a genuinely helpful and friendly bunch. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancito
Reviews.Content: From a purely practical standpoint, the hotel rooms were clean and beautifully decorated, the staff were helpful and cordial without being overly perky (pet peeve of mine). But the really amazing aspect of the Gladstone is the fact that each room is a different work of art, they are just truly beautiful, the idea for having such diverse decorating themes in each room is so innovative, it was amazing. I was there at Christmas and sometimes hotel staff at holiday time can make you feel like they're annoyed that you're there, this was not the case though. I will definitely return to the Gladstone and I would suggest that visitors to Toronto check out their website - www.gladstonehotel.com to check out the different rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!”
Reviews.Author: chapstick080908
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gladstone and were very impressed. As many others have said previously, it's a very different hotel full of life and charisma. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone staying in Toronto. In addition, we enjoyed a hearty breakfast in the morning and were very pleased with the portion size and value for our money. Great place, would definitely go back if I had the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: justaminette
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Gladstone was such a wonderfully unique experience. The hotel was very accommodating when we experience delays getting there due to winter weather conditions. The room was warm and cozy, the homemade soaps where a special touch. We had breakfast in the morning at the cafe... the food was fresh, local, and amazing. We're planning on coming back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “totally awesome, unique and casual”
Reviews.Author: kikisurlalac
Reviews.Content: as a frequest business traveller it was refreshing to stay in a super friendly hotel that felt like being at home great night time parties downstairs, knowledgable and friendly staff cafe is great for breakfast after a big night at the bar totally recommended!

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: lagauche
Reviews.Content: This is a unique spot, loved it. It's essentially an art gallery with hotel rooms, every single room is completely different, designed by a different artist or designer. I'd say the hotel is more suited to younger crowd, they had some pretty loud nightlife on the main floor (hotel rooms are on 3rd and 4th floor). The restaurant on the main floor was really really good, best risotto I've ever had. It's true front desk staff could be a bit more knowledgeable on the galleries/restaurants/nightlife, but I've never been one to completely rely on someone else to plan my trip anyways, and there's so much right in the area, turning right or left is not the worst suggestion in the world (as the last reviewer made it out to be), it's right next door to great dining and nightlife... I like Unit right next door, and the beaver next to that. and there are dozens of galleries and design shops within a few blocks. The area is a bit interesting, I wouldn't say seedy, maybe it was once upon a time but it looks to be going through some major changes right now. It's nothing you wouldn't see in any major city, I never felt unsafe or anything. Overall though, a good experience. I'll definitely be back to check out some of the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it- not all that it appears to be- staff could care less!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_rochester
Reviews.Content: I am quite disappointed with my stay at The Gladstone Hotel. While the room we stayed in (Big Wood) was pretty cool and very clean, the rest of the experience was not very enjoyable. We found the location was just a few blocks too far away from the trendy shops that we went to check out. The area of the hotel, to us, seemed a bit seedy (homeless people, etc). Furthermore we were very disappointed that the parking was so poor. The hotel has zero parking. we were directed to a Price Chopper parking lot behind the hotel that had very poor lighting (in a seedy neighborhood) and there did not appear to be any security. What was most disappointing was the staff. we were greeted by a woman that seemed as though checking us in was a pain in her butt. Then to top it of we asked where we should go for shopping and she gave us a blank stare. She said "um, I guess you could go out the front door and turn left or right"- thanks Lady for that helpful nugget! That same night we asked the guy at the front desk where he suggested going for Italian food. He gave us a map and pointed us towards Little Italy (NOT!). He actually gave us directions to a a different Portuguese neighborhood just a few blocks away. We did not know we were a couple blocks off until much later that night after we had a very average meal at someplace we did not want to go. Then.. that night at 4am we were awaken by a ton of noise in the hallway. I looked up at the door form my bed and noticed that there were louvers above the door, so of course noise travels. This sucked! Top that off with tons of noise from the street. they gave us ear plugs, but that was not enough. That should have been our clue to switch rooms or hotels. The hotel is pretty funky- certainly lived up to that reputation, if only the staff was as interesting as the art on the walls!

Reviews.Title: “And now for something completely different!”
Reviews.Author: Anglomontrealer55
Reviews.Content: I am from Montreal and was totally unprepared for the Gladstone. My co-worker had taken care of the hotel arrangements for us and when we arrived I was totally taken off guard by the 'antler chairs' in the lobby, the turn of the last century elevator, and the wonderful attitude of the clerk at the front desk. The elevator man was waiting for our looks of surprise when we arrived on the 3rd floor!!! A generous lobby with comfortable chairs from ages past, artwork hanging from the ceiling and on the walls (and not your standard artwork either!!) and judys' dressed in period costume gave the impression our rooms were in an art gallery. The room was not the biggest one I had ever stayed in but decor made it the most interesting one! I had fur curtains that hung from 12 foot ceilings and another fur on my bed. No standard lights on the ceiling - only the best of chandeliers would do!! A four poster bed made of logs gave the impression someone had just cut down a tree to make it for me â€“ and I slept like a log! The shower was intimate â€“ no bending over to pick up the soap but everything was spotless. Are you looking for the unusual? Bring your camera and experience the wonderful service, dining and atmosphere of a great hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and comfortable place to stay. Not your usual hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller4u
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend the Gladstone to anyone. Unique, clean, comfortable Artist designed rooms, good food, amazing lattes, great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique hotel......”
Reviews.Author: MeganToronto
Reviews.Content: I have been to Gladstone Hotel because of the various food, arts & design functions that it often hosts. These functions have been fabulous as well so I recommend going to them as well. The renovated hotel is a very classy venue for such events. I definitely recommend Gladstone Hotel as a special retreat for anyone who likes interior design and arts. It is a unique hotel with professionally designed and individualized rooms with diverse themes, which accommodates diverse styles and tastes. I'm sure after reviewing their room catalogue; one is bound to find a uniquely designed room that they like. Although, I have never personally stayed in any of their rooms (I live in Toronto) I am absolutely taken by the designs and definitely recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing, comfortable, unique and welcoming business destination”
Reviews.Author: Eden_Textile
Reviews.Content: We are the Gladstone Hotel's supplier of linen for both their bedrooms and bathrooms. The Gladstone only accepts the very best for their location. They only request the highest quality linens, duvets, towels and pillows for their guests, and refuse to accept any other. The artistic, unique and luxurious rooms are a refreshing experience to anyones vacation or business trip. You don't feel like your in a hotel at all, more like a personal retreat. The staff are always friendly, courteous, and accommodating. We are proud at Eden Textile to be in partnership with the Gladstone Hotel. Your stay is sure to be a rewarding and relaxing experience! Eden Textile Customer Service Manager

Reviews.Title: “The Felt Room”
Reviews.Author: FunDi1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gladstone for one night with my family from Pennsylvania. The girls shared the Felt Room and The Guys shared the other room with big curtains...I can't remember the name. We did not have any trouble with noise, it was actually pretty quiet, and we were afraid of being too loud in the hallways. One thing that made a difference for me was the fact that there are no carpets in the rooms. I think that was the cleanest room I've ever stayed in. The entire hotel is amazing. There was art everywhere. Everything was so beautiful: the elevator, the wood work and bricks. They let us park right behind the building when we arrived. There is a restaurant and a bar on the main floor, and I could write a book about them! I definitely recommend the Gladstone Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel? It's so much more.”
Reviews.Author: GreenMosquito
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone Hotel is a great place in Toronto for so many reasons, aside from being a hotel. They have created unique spaces for musicians, artists, foodies and families...to showcase, perform and indulge. They support and promote local and organic eating ( by the way they have a FRY BAR...sweet potato, potato and taro too with tons of toppings). Harvest Wednesdays supporting field to table eating (yum) are not to be missed...and while you are there, you'll know why you need to try the Gladstone.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time...still a charm”
Reviews.Author: KikiTee
Reviews.Content: So this is our 3rd trip here. All the fantastic things I love about it are still fantastic. Beds and bedding are still the absolute best. Staff is still great. Food is some of the best around. The hotel/restaurant is part of a farm co-op so all the food is either brought in organic or locally grown. Of course...all the bad things are also still there. Old building noises when you're trying to sleep...no proper shampoo or conditioner. This is a hotel for young people there to have fun. Keep that in mind if you think you want to go here for business. That's the only rule to keep in mind. On a sad note, Hank--the elevator operator recently passed away from a lengthy disease, so no fun stories about the hotel. But...he did always say that he'd stick around in room 414 if that's your thing!

Reviews.Title: “gladstone was awesome”
Reviews.Author: nantendo
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel was very unique and clean. Each room is designed differently and as for our room it was very comfortable and lovely. Yes the bathroom was small and we had to park our car on the side of a grocery store, and most time we couldn't get the elevator operator to bring up the 105 year old manually operated elevator to our floor (4th), but the hotel cafe was great, delicious organic food, the free soaps in the room were also organic and smelled great, the art work shown on each floor was wonderful, especially for me as an artist. I really enjoyed the location it reminded me of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, very artsy and filled with great little boutiques and cafes. We were exhausted from our 12 hr drive but I was delighted as soon as I saw the hotel. It looked so welcoming after a long rainy day. We got the parking sorted out ( $15/ night) and got our room right away, which we didn't get to preselect because we booked through booking.com, but we were pleasantly surprised. It was small but very well designed. Super clean and the bed was very comfy. We ate dinner one night in the hotel restaurant and it was fantastic. We also got some coffee and baked goods in the morning from there which were delicious as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Is it really for you?”
Reviews.Author: belleamie10
Reviews.Content: It is an interesting place, but is it for you? We only saw 1 other person beside us who was over 30 years old. We arrived to a front lobby full of wedding guests heading to the 2nd floor hall. We returned that night at 2 am to front steps, front lobby full of young people having fun. They were from the Hallowe'en dance at Gladstone's hall on the 1rst floor. The loud, blaring music stopped at 2:45 am (or 1:45 am once you changed your clock). Imagine if you had hoped for a restful night's sleep !!! City sounds (streetcars, city buses, cars with loud mufflers, people laughing & heading home after parties) are not normal for us. Needless to say we hardly slept. The large bed & pillows were very comfortable. There was also a draft coming through the single-pane windows in our room, which was street side. The next morning we faced another herd of nice, young people lined up inside & outside for some king of fair being held in Gladstone's party room, lobby & coffee/tea bar. It is an interesting place ... maybe choose a room in the back, on the hotel half that is not above the party room ??? Be part of the action, or you'll feel terribly ignored and forgotten. Be willing to accept NO coffee maker in the room, their morning coffee bar in the lobby may be closed, the $15 is for outdoor parking. We had to park 1 1/2 blocks away to off-load our luggage as there was not one free spot closer when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: hicate
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone is different from the big hotel chains so if you are fed up with the same old thing, check it out. We stayed in 2 different rooms (spent a night in Niagara Falls in between). Although they were the 'larger' rooms, with bath tub, they were both smaller than you might be used to but were really interesting and most importantly, the beds were great! Also the linen, pillows, towels- all high quality. There was adequate room for clothes, cases etc. The hotel staff were excellent, cheerful and helpful. The restored elevator is a feature- yes (as someone else said) you have to call the lift... but thats true for any lift! The food was good- especially the coffee and the Queens West tea and the grilled cheese for breakfast was great. (walnut raisin bread, applejack cheese and apple) At weekends try the pancakes with caramelised apple! On friday night there is karaoke in the Melody Bar- dont miss it! Saturday its Country Music.... but plenty of other venues near by if thats not your style.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Artsy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0811
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Toronto where I spent three nights in Gladstone Hotel. The hotel rooms are all different, designed & decorated by artists. Our room was small, relatively quiet, facing Gladstone Road rather than the noisier Queen's, the bathroom was adequate, having nice deep bathtub & shower. We had only one breakfast there which was very good, a bit expensive, but the orange juice tasted freshly squeezed & the croissants were very fresh. Location: great, if you want to be in the Arts District; also a supermarket is closeby if you want to buy some snacks, juice, or toiletries... Staff: Very friendly, knowledgeable. Rates per room: Our rate was great, I believe the standard rate starts at $195/night to about $400. The hotel was not at all full; after the Film Festival, most hotels had many vacancies. Unique elevator: Basically you have to have a staff member to operate it. Most people find it charming; being independent, I find this bothersome. We never used the elevator operator to get down, which is OK when you have nothing to carry. The room was relatively quiet, except the heating, which was extremely noisy - that is why earplugs were left in the room for us to use. The bed was hard, bedding quality (duvet, etc.) high. High speed internet: free, worked great. We did not use the room's safe. As the soap, shampoo, & cream are all organic types, I would recommend bringing your own toiletries.... I could not tell the difference between the soap bar & shampoo bar; so I purchased my own (Price Checker Supermarket is just behind the hotel) I would recommend this hotel to somebody who is looking for a unique hotel. I attended one function in nearby Drake Hotel which was a lot more noisier & apparently more expensive hotel in the Art District.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in an art gallery”
Reviews.Author: SoniaLaStrega
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous, unique hotel in a fabulous Toronto neighbourhood. Art is everywhere, in the rooms, the common spaces and hallways. It's not always a wonderful thing, as I found when I was hauling my bag of laundry back from the cleaners through a gaggle of hipsters viewing the art outside my room, but it does make for an interesting stay. The staff were great - enormously helpful even very early in the morning when I was heading out to the airport. Free wifi was a bonus, even though it was down the last day of our stay. On the downside, even though the rooms are beautiful, they are very small, and the bathrooms even more so, and if this is an issue for you then you may want to stay somewhere else. There was also a perplexing lack of power outlets in the room which necessitated unplugging things so we could charge phones and computers. But overall I really enjoyed The Gladstone and would recommend it to just about anyone (maybe not my parents).

Reviews.Title: “Very knowledeable and friendly staff!! Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MikeGMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tower Suite to celebrate our wedding! The staff was extremely gracious. Cowboy Hank was a most unique individual and shared many past experiences with us. The elevator was totally cool. The food was always great! Great, great hotel if you don't want to stay at a cookie-cutter hotel. Very unique and hip! The front desk staff was extremely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising . . .”
Reviews.Author: Queenston
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say? When we alighted from the taxi, my friend said, "This looks like the Occidental." We are from Winnipeg. That is not a compliment. As we hauled our suitcases up the wooden steps into the, shall I say questionable, front lobby, we were wondering about why one might have decided to have a wedding there. But I must say, by the time we left after two nights, we thought differently. It was a bit like going back to life in the dorm, and because of that all the out-of towners for the wedding were able to hang out and get to know each other--well, maybe not so much for those over 80! The stairs are a bit of an issue, as one has to call the elevator. But the staff were wonderful, the food at the wedding was delicious, and when my air conditioning was not working, they moved me to a new room and knocked $30 off the bill. The beds were very comfortable. The caveats: don't expect to be able to shave your legs in the shower. I am short and not a large lady, and I had to keep the shower door open to do so and almost put my back out of commission. No shampoo or conditioner, so bring your own (I have never encountered that in a hotel). Be prepared to get bruises on your legs as you attempt to navigate around the bed--the rooms (both of the ones I had) are smaller than anything I have ever experienced in continental Europe. Although many have commented on the artistic appeal of the rooms, the decorations seemed a bit chintzy to me. On the first night, the room was literally shaking from the noise in the bar downstairs. I think that if you are in your twenties and out for a good time, this is the place to stay. I am sure the pawn shop next door and the rehab clinic across the street would be considered as adding local colour. But as for me, the next time I am in Toronto, I will be checking into the Le Germaine!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jen_ballardie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 22nd-24th Aug. The Gladstone is a beautiful hotel with funky art in each room (althoughthe rooms are quite small) in a really interesting part of Toronto but I was a disappointed with the disorganisation at check in and it really impacted on my stay there. I did mention a couple of times to the front desk staff but just wanted to reiterate. Although the staff were lovely & friendly & cool, one thing really annoyed me- I arrived at hotel at 3pm on 22nd Aug after a long flight, feeling jet lagged.Wanted to go for snooze and shower before heading out to meet a friend & explore but I was told my room would not be ready for 10 mins. I had a walk up the road to have a look and came back 50 mins later. I was told it still wasn't ready and would be another 20 mins. Bit disappointed but had another quick walk and came back after 20 mins exactly to be told it would be a further 15 mins. The guy on reception was very nice and got me an iced tea while I waited. 15 mins went by & another group waiting were told their room was ready. Nothing said about mine. 40 mins went by & no one had come to tell me it was ready. I went to reception & they gave me the key but said a maid would be round so I could go up and drop my bags in the room but would have to vacate when maid came to clean the room. Upon entering the room, it looked great and clean to me, I didn't think it needed linens changing-looked clean to me, but the maid told me on the way up she would be in soon. I waited for an hour and no sign of her. I couldn't have a sleep or shower incase she turned up. By this time it was 6pm and as I was only in Toronto for 2 days I decided to head out to explore anyway despite feeling exhausted and in need of a shower. When I got back later that evening,nothing had even been done to the room! I told the reception staff & it turned out that the room hadn't needed changing in the first place! Felt frustrated that I had been waiting 3 hours & nothing needed doing anyway & wasted time waiting when I could have been catching up on much needed sleep! Was pretty annoyed I couldn't shower and get ready properly to meet my friend as I felt pretty yucky from the flight. I was a bit disappointed that after having waited 3 hours (and could have been longer if I hadn't gone out) that nothing could be done to rectify this- after all, I had missed out on an afternoon that I had prepaid for. I felt especially annoyed as it had been prepaid for, so staff must have been aware I would arrive! I had a bottle of wine in the room and felt possibly this could have been reimbursed as a gesture to apologise but was told nothing could be done as I had booked through an agent. Quite disappointed in the service and although the hotel was gorgeous, and in the kind of arty area I liked to stay in, it seemed the staff are more concerned with the kudos of an arty hotel rather than providing a good and relaxing service and stay, I don't think I would stay again or recommened due to this. Bar seemed cool and lots of music events going on but no room service which was disappointing. The hotel was a lovely old building with original floor boards and an amazing old elevator, but these features, even with the individual artworks in each room, don't mean anything if the hotel service itself is not up to scratch. It felt a bit more like a posh hostel than a hotel. Which is fine if that's what you're after, but it's not clear on the website that's how it is. I went on to stay in New York and the service at the hotel there (The Standard) was amazing and faultless. Would have been great if it had been at The Gladstone!

Reviews.Title: “For hipster night owls, not for business folks or families”
Reviews.Author: peterme
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to staying here, but I was quite disappointed. I was in town on business for a week, and my wife and child stayed with me the first day. The Gladstone is clearly more interested in being an arts/cafe/performance/bar venue for hipsters than a hotel. Details don't get addressed, the rooms are crazy small, and it's just not comfortable for any extended stay. I will try The Drake next time.

Reviews.Title: “Think we should call it Sadstone instead of Gladstone--NOT a business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CamelSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My 2 hrs staying at this hotel left much to be desired. If you are in your 20's and on vacation, then the Gladstone might be for you. But if you happen to be in Toronto on business but still are looking for a boutique experience--I recommend you keep on looking. The premises is reminscent of a dorm or hostel, and the rooms are the size of a postage stamp. My room also smelled like smoke and looked out over a busy street rife with graffiti and characters of all kinds. (see photo attached). There were also earplugs provided which indicated that I would not have a solid night sleep ahead of me. I quickly determined that I could not do my business and remain in this hotel. I couldn't even slip out the back door--because you must have a hotel staff member operate the old elevator for you. I got a great last minute rate the Windsor Arms Hotel in Yorktown, which is far better suited for business needs. Upon my exit of the Gladstone, I was bon-voyaged by an interesting couple--he with mohawk, pantent leather pants and plaid blazer, and she in wheelchair AND wearing rollerskates topped with a red feather boa. I think that's just the clientelle the Gladstone is best suited for. I do have to admit that the Gladstone staff was very obliging and helped be undo my room reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Think of it as a contemporary/outsider art museum you can sleep in...”
Reviews.Author: nycdave
Reviews.Content: The Gladstone Hotel, let us be clear, is a very unique experience. It is likely to be less than satisfactory for travelers looking for the seamless luxury of a Ritz, or the preening stylishness of a W. This is a truly boutique hotel, whose every element is totally unique and not to be found anywhere else. Think of it as a strange hybrid of hotel, B&B, art gallery, commune, museum, and Beat-era coffeehouse. Be prepared for an adventure, an active stay, and (if you turn in before other denziens) use of (freely provided) earplugs, though, and you'll have a great time! As noted in every summary of this hotel, each room is a totally unique design put together by local artists/designers. My friend and I stayed in the Blue Line room (#318), which I think looks a bit better in photographs than in person. While kept very clean, it's clear that some guests have been less than gentle to some parts of the furniture (though any white foil finish is going to be put to the test holding up in a hotel environment). Designs in other rooms run from spare and contemporary, to lavishly retro, to out-and-out camp. The bed and pillows were excellent and comfortable, and the climate control was great. The organic, locally produced bath soaps and toiletries were wonderful -- I particularly enjoyed the solid shampoo/conditioner bar, although some guests might find it takes some getting used to. The shower was uncomfortably small, and would be very cramped for a larger or taller person. In spite of the come-hither silhouettes outlined on various walls, in other words, the shower is definitely one place you would not be having any sort of liasons in this room! I'd advise couples on a romantic visit to opt for a larger room with a full tub. The building is incredible, and has been very lovingly restored. The old manual-operated elevator is a distinctive touch, and the well-worn wood floors and super-sized windows add a vintage historic backdrop to the modern and funky art and designs showcased around the building. Each floor has a large common area, sometimes used for art classes, or, the weekend I was there, a course in burlesque! The food and drinks downstairs at the cafe and at the bar & restaurant were wonderfully tasty and fresh, and the neighborhood offers plenty of other options, from Pizza Pizza to Ethiopian. Speaking of the neighborhood, you'll find the Queen Street tramline right outside the door, as well as a bus running north up Gladstone Ave. There's a lot of wonderful boutiques, galleries, and spots to discover in the area as you head towards downtown. Maybe not ideal for itinerary-focused tourists (its about a 30-40 minute walk, 15 minute tram, or 10-15 CAD cab ride to the center of downtown), but great if you like a more unique and local scene. Arts and music are very big out in this area, and the bar downstairs hosts popular karaoke and live music events. The Drake Hotel down the street also has a popular music club. If the Drake crowd is a little bit more overt in its efforts to be fashionable, the Gladstone definitely sports a more friendly "come as you are" vibe. Old, young, in drag, in masks, in hawaiian shirts, in cowboy hats or hipster threads. The staff was good, with a few exceptionally helpful and friendly individuals. A few of their co-workers came off as either "arrogant hipster" types, or "trying and failing to go above and beyond," but these were the exception rather than the rule! Overall, I would readily stay at the Gladstone again in Toronto, if only to explore the other room designs, and to enjoy a wonderfully funky area and atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “L-O-V-E This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: veggies81
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by everything at the Gladstone! Where to begin... the service was amazing. We mentioned that we were interested in seeing a performance being held at the hotel unfortunately the hotel was sold out of tickets but the front desk staff went out of their way to find tickets for us at a local shop that was also selling tickets without us even having to ask. The room was very clean especially the shower (finally a hotel shower that I wasn't afraid to step in). The bed , pillowsand duvet were amazing! I cannot remember the last time that I slept so well. Parking was available right behind the hotel for $10 and we were able to buy a subway pass right at the hotel. We had breakfast at the hotel the next day and everything that we ordered was delicious (granola & yogurt, frittata, eggs). The burlesque show that we saw was very entertaining, and the karoke bar next door was also a lot of fun. We could have spent our entire stay at the hotel and we would not have been bored. I am looking forward to returning hopefully for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Gladstone is THE Destination for Funky and Unique!”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: We booked the Refresh Suite at the Gladstone to celebrate our 5th anniversary. Unlike other hotels, the Gladstone has artist designed rooms that each have a different theme. Upon booking, we submitted our top 5 selections, and the staff assigned us what was available. Despite sounding labor intensive, it was a relatively easy process. At check-in, the staff was extremely helpful and included welcome vouchers for the restaurant and bar that we could use immediately. Adjacent parking was easily arranged at the front desk, who made sure that we had proper details for display in the car. The staff also warned us that a large event would be held on site that night and asked us to let them know immediately if it was too noisy. We never heard a thing. Our room, the Refresh Suite, was well appointed, clean and comfortable. The linens were high thread count, with perfectly firm mattress and pillows. The organic bath products were awesome, and the public areas outside our room were quiet and cozy. This hotel also includes exhibits in each public hall, and we enjoyed the Canadian architecture show that was up while we were there. The restaurant and bar on site was excellent - a great place to relax and people watch. Both the breakfasts each day and the dinner we sampled there were tasty and well presented. It was a fabulous alternative for tired people who flew and then drove for most of the day. The neighborhood around the Gladstone is transitional, with construction going on across the street. We heard no noise from the site. Containing galleries, hip shops and restaurants, the area is a fun and interesting place to walk. The trolley cars also run back and forth along Queen Street, easily accessible to anyone tired of walking. Our favorite neighborhood find was a restaurant called Odd Fellows. My only complaint about the Gladstone is the lack of an I Pod player in the room. Mod hotels are providing these standard now. When we requested one, the staff sent up an antiquated tiny clock radio with a cord jack for playing the I Pod. It was useless. Hopefully, future visitors will find a suitable I Pod appliance in each room. The Gladstone is an interesting hotel concept that I hope to encounter again in the future. I recommend it highly as a welcome alternative to the "usual."

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, set in a beautiful grand old building”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Moondog
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a different feel from the the norm. It has bags of character and that's even before you get to your elaborate designed room. We stayed in Room 308 Suite on Queen Street. It was very cosy, i.e. small, but well designed, so it wasn't a problem at all. You could take breakfast down stairs and there is also a bar and function room, there is always something going on. The street car stops right outside, and tickets can be bought at the hotel, so very handy. So even though it's not in the heart of town this is not a problem. The only bad point I could say is the level of noise we could here from the street, it did feel like the street was in our room, but in the end we got used to this, and this can be forgiven beacause all in all a great stay in a very fun hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GetAway524
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Valentine's Day, and it was a great place to visit. The room I stayed in was clean, the service was relaxed but really friendly and helpful, and the hotel is just so cool. There are interesting things to look at everywhere you look, the hotel is one big piece of art. The 100 year old elevator is really different, and so is the cowboy that operates it - you don't get that at the Hilton, and I loved it. Also, as an added bonus for me - they have vegan breakfast in the cafe downstairs. I had the tofu scamble and coconut chai latte, and it was the best breakfast ever. There is a bar downstairs, but the noise did not bother us at all, and for those who care there are earplugs provided in the room. There was no parking available - but we parked on the street, it was fine. Overall, it was great, I would totally recommend it and I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Gladstone!”
Reviews.Author: speedgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic independent old hotel. The whole place is very old and artsy. Great old elevator that they have to call for you. Staff was incredibly helpful - thanks to Alex and Adam especially!! Rooms are more European sized. Stayed one night in room 314-the Billio Room. Beautiful room with a good sized bathroom. Stayed the next two nights in room 309 the Puzzle Room. Still a good sized room but the shower stall is very small. Shaving legs will require some yoga. The street noise level is very high but they do supply ear plugs. The cafe is very good and the coffee is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto's Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: gcameron
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of the same old hotel room when you travel, the Gladstone is a welcome departure. Staying at the Gladstone is an experience in itself. Each room has been decorated by a different artist and is unique in decor. The standard rooms are small, but more than adequate for couples. I would not recommend this hotel for families or business travellers, and I cannot imagine that is the target market of the Gladstone. The rooms are extremely clean and well maintained. Noise is a bit of a mystery. As some reviewers have mentioned, you can hear other guests very clearly when they are in the halls. So we wondered about the noise between rooms. We heard nothing all night, and were surprised to find that the room adjacent to ours had been occupied, as we saw the staff cleaning the room. Either the rooms are very soundproof, or the couple next to us tipped-toed in and out of their room. The Cafe is wonderful, serving perhaps the best americano I have had in recent memory. And take time to enjoy the art that is everywhere. The light fixtures in the cafe are each a piece of art created from tacky old lamps that we have all seen in a living room in the seventies. Try the vegan chocolate avocado tart (I'm not even a vegatarian, let alone vegan)! Yes the elevator is a bit dated, but it adds to the charm of this hotel that dates back to the 1800s. The elevator is 104 years old! Art is everywhere. The best part of our stay was the staff. Extremely friendly and seemingly would bend over backward for us. The area the hotel is located looks a bit seedy, but this is Toronto folks. I would have no problem walking around, and in fact made a brief trek down the street after dark. So if you prefer to wake up in the morning and not know whether you are in a Hilton or a Holiday Inn; if you prefer art on the walls that is mass-produced; if you prefered hotel employees dressed in ill- fitting uniforms; and if you need a door on your closet: by all means, pick another hotel. The Gladstone is unique in every way, including its eclectic collection of seemingly very happy employees. I can't wait to go back. The Gladstone will be a regular stop for us from now on. So "glad' we found it. (Sorry for the bad humour, just couldn't resist). Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Something different and a little less bland”
Reviews.Author: liese17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gladstone hotel on our last night in Toronto after having lived in the neighbourhood for 2 years (before moving back to Australia). We had often enjoyed a drink in the bar downstairs and felt that staying there would be very fitting as a final farewell to all we loved about Queen Street West. We weren't at all disappointed in the hotel - We found many North American hotels tend to be comfortable but bland and unremarkable. The Gladstone is anything but! The room was small but gorgeously decorated, and it felt really special to know that it was unique. I plan to stay there again whenever I return to Toronto for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: feather_pillows
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Gladstone about 6 or 7 times over the past year and love going back. it's a great place to visit with friends, and a welcome change from anonymous hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, Unique Hotel - great for young couples”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Gladstone Hotel and loved it! We loved to be able to chose our own artist-designed room and found the whole hotel to be great. Definitely a smaller room than most hotels, but wonderful brick facades, hardwood floors and clean bathroom. Comfortable bed, beautiful 3rd floor view of Toronto with a wall of floor to ceiling windows. The location wasn't great, but is on Queen Street West and is a long walk or quick driving to great shops and restaurants. The reception desk was efficient, but not the most friendly... but the bartender more than made up for it. Good food, very reliable. The parking was reasonable at $10/night just across the street from the hotel. Also, free internet! Would stay here again, just in a new artist-designed room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wedding”
Reviews.Author: petitepouliche
Reviews.Content: we recently had our wedding (in the first floor ballroom) and reception( second floor reception space) at the gladstone and it was wonderful! the planning process was a little slow and communication somewhat sporadic (i think there were some staff changes somewhere in there), slow to get catering options, confirmation of things, etc. but the day of, everything was perfect. things just happened and we had to worry about nothing. teh catering was great, tasty tasty sushi! many of our guests stayed at the hotel (from my grandmother to friends with newborns, to of course, hipsters) and everyone was utterly impressed. the staff were extraordinarily accomodating and friendly and everyone felt very comfortable. the rooms are beautiful and all design is very thoughtfull, the beds are also incredibly comfortable. the gladstone does not sacrifice comfort for character. we definately reccomend this hotel for hosting an event or for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Vibe @ The Gladstone”
Reviews.Author: canadatom
Reviews.Content: How can you not like a hotel where you have an opportunity to share a beer in the karaoke bar @ 1:00 AM with the chap who earlier in the day shows you to your room? The staff were friendly, accommodating & laid back. I am glad that it is not overly restored and obsessed with being cool.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and great value”
Reviews.Author: Brodiej
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gladstone this June for 7 nights. Its a great hotel and represents great value in a really interesting area of the city. The Drake hotel is 200 yards up the road, double the price and has half the character...although very smart. Our room was small but adequate and well kept. The downstairs cafe serves great food, and while we were there there was live music and comedy every single night. The staff were very helpful and friendly and i'd definitely recommend the hotel for future stays. The Gladstone would particularly suit young couples looking for some culture, good food and music at a reasonable price.

HotelInfo.Name: Gladstone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1214 Queen Street West, Toronto, Ontario M6J 1J6, Canada
